fDINw-yNz1W2maHFD4oL3g.text: It's not the best pho I've had, or even good. I'd probably rate it as mediocre pho to be honest, however the service is actually fast and straightforward. I do like the $1 option for extra noodle and I think $3 for extra meat. Prices are also a little higher than I've seen at other pho places, but it's certainly not overpriced or bad.  It's decent for the location since it's very close to the strip in an open strip mall and there is also a big wide area for seating. I didn't try the sandwiches though, but I was in a mood for noodles. Perhaps next time.

bUgHMJx-WKvaADrZWXwATg.text: This place has bread, and yes, I mean the literal kind that comes in loaves. The bread is a magical combination of crusty, crunchy and soft all at the same time. How do they do that? Definitely magic. This element pretty much guarantees they are going to have a good banh mi, and that is exactly what they have.   I like it, but I do not absolutely love it. The bread is so delightful they should make it a foot long! Alas, the sandwiches are a little small. They offer a tofu option, which I appreciate, but their tofu filling is not especially flavorful. It tastes like tofu, not necessarily bad, but not miraculous. They could spice that bean curd up a bit.  As for the pho, I would describe it as good, not flavorless, but also not the best. Plus, they aren't able to serve up a vegetable filled pho, which as you may know is my standard for judging pho places.  Lastly, the service has always been haphazard when we have visited. The last time they were out of jalapenos. What? And, it was unclear if there was really a waiter in the dining area, as no one consistently checked in with us and it took a while for our food to come out. Plus, their menu pricing and what they charge doesn't seem to be the same. We have been confused by our bill on both occasions. Be sure to double check your bill if you go!   In conclusion, the bread is their secret sauce.

rawx74pTTciUgJhbSmwWkQ.text: Definitely enjoyed the grilled chicken sandwich. Coming back for sure.

photos.caption: Photo of Pho Thanh Huong - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Thai tea and grilled chicken! Mmm!
Photo of Pho Thanh Huong - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Pho Thanh Huong - Las Vegas, NV, United States

FElZmStGCLhJHtiBI60CwQ.text: Grilled pork sandwich is the best, it is only $3.50.  Pho is great.  But is that price is higher than most places???

29UMVFZ1_dH57R_SlHODqQ.text: My favorite place to slurp on a bowl of hot Pho and inhale delicious tasty sandwiches is Pho Thanh Huong. Portions are generous. A regular size bowl is big enough for 2 depending on how hungry you are and it comes steamy hot right out of the kitchen doors,  with all the plant fixins to garnish your bath tub bowl of soup. What I like most about their soups is, they dont skimp out on the meat and they give you a variety of proteins to choose from. The grilled pork and chicken sandwiches are scrumptious, light and crunchy.  Every bite is full of delicious flavor. Very reasonable price for such a bangable sandwich. Spring rolls, and fried rolls are no doubt delectable. Eat with caution though, as you can easily fill up with these appetizers that your entree may feel neglected... you might need a to go box after 2 bites. Service is fast and friendly. Easy access, no high traffic customer wait time. Slight downfall is the area. Just be sure not to wear your Gucci jogging suit dripping in gold herring bones. Youll be sure to be jacked before you get to the door.

Nq56dipaaieEMKcB8-Vl6g.text: Happened to be on the east side and in need of a quick lunch,  so I though I would try this place out.    I ordered the pho with beef.  It was pretty, pretty, pretty good.  The broth did have the umami type element that we all enjoy.  The condiments were fresh.  The service was suspect. Not because the employees don't speak english, but just bad service.  I walk in and it has a counter like a quick service restaurant so I stood at the counter for 5 minutes.  So I finally asked the woman working behind the counter - "how can I get some food?" then she pointed to the tables.  Someone finally took my order after I sat down.  I got the food fast which was good.  So I ate - I waited for ever to get a bill...  I finally walk up to the counter I said " I would like to pay now."   She was very confused.  So the food was - good - the service was weird - I just don't know why people own restaurants with out any people skills!

6FfFLz7DNGjGfPbH0sRWhQ.text: My wife and I always seek out Asian food when we're in the USA and oftentimes a craving for some good Pho comes all over us!  Pho Thanh Huong Restaurant is our 3rd Pho Restaurant attempt in Vegas and it's the best from all! First thing that greeted us was a very friendly smile and offer to choose any table we like. We already had a good feeling. We both went for King Size Pho bowl with all the meats inside (well, I went without tendons). We also ordered 4 spring rolls.  The bowl of Pho was HUGE!  Our greedy foodie hearts filled with joy at seeing such a size. However more importantly, it was also very tasty. The restaurant also had the small fresh red hot chilli peppers for us, which we like to add to provide some extra spiciness. It's always a plus when they have it and bring those out! Again, all the service was with a smile which is very important to us.  The restaurant has free WiFi hotspot as well.   We came back the next day for Grilled Pork + Shrimp + Eggroll vermicelli, and it was also very much to satisfaction. The menu didn't provide for a King Size version for the vermicelli, but we asked anyway... and they flexibly provided! They said we were the first to order it. We like flexible restaurants :)  5 stars! Would come back definitely.

E5_TBOY7qa3JoWbipb6WTQ.text: My neighborhood pho spot always delivers just what I am looking for. I get the rare beef pho, usually to go. No extra helping of noodles needed, and once all fixings are added the soup has some decent spice and plenty of flavor. When the weather gets cold I find myself running in there all the time. The banh mi sandwiches are ok, although I personally prefer Mr. Lee.

5ppA8SDtYbcB_iOHvElkTA.text: Man this is hard to beat, for $2.75 you can get any one of TWENTY different sandwiches FUCK THEY ARE GOOD!!! You only really need probably one, though I crammed down another for good measure!  The Vietcong Iced Coffee is excellent on a hot night to wash it all down!

photos.caption: Photo of Pho Thanh Huong - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Pho Thanh Huong - Las Vegas, NV, United States

cre21EMEJxDoh_wXMTShrw.text: Love this vietnamese restaurant! I really enjoy the Pho here.  The noodles are cooked perfectly and the broth is very comforting while packing a lot of flavor.  I can't get a decent bowl of Pho where I live so it's always a nice treat when I come to Vegas and get a taste of this place.  My most favorite thing about PTH is their sandwiches!!! The last time I went I got the grilled pork & the grilled chicken with pate.  Both were sooo GOOD!  I love the bread that they use.  Yes I like Lee's in the OC but their bread is too hard.  The bread is here light & fluffy, toasted & a great compliment to whichever meat you order.  I really liked their pickled carrots & daikon here, along with the slices of jalapeno inside.  Definitely a keeper in my book.  Plus each sandwich is $2.75!! Talk about dirt cheap.    I'm full every time I leave & my wallet doesn't yell at me.  Wish I could go here every week!! WAAAAAH!

gCyIJDJy_nOl2NAowCmisA.text: This is my new favorite place for Vietnamese food everything we ordered was absolutely delicious. I have to disagree with some other reviews about there service because they were very friendly and made sure we had everything we needed. Now I can avoid the lines and extra drive out to spring mountain when I want some Vietnamese food. Thanks yelpers for helping me decide to eat here.

0-uVoq2nGkBHZlAaZ_bDYA.text: Great service and great pho. Fried rice is amazing.

khGCUHAAWb7p4XhpFzSZOw.text: After making the rounds to various Banh mi shops all over town, this is by far my favorite !!! Being a 9-5er in the Spring Mountain area it pains me that none of the ones in the Spring Mountain area can live up to this place, but it's True. Yup, you must leave Chinatown to get your Vietnamese  sandwich fix!

NXMK2bI5k0px0_W7IxyObg.text: I ordered some sandwiches and I told the person taking the order 3x NO freak'n mayo in my sammies.  Not once, not twice, but thrice.  WTF!!!  And yet again, I got sammies with mayo.    The problem was not that I didn't repeat myself many times over, the problem was that she was on the phone talking to a family member.  Couldn't be bothered to excuse herself to take my order properly.  The one thing people cannot do is talk on the phone and take orders at the same time.  That's how you f#%$ up the orders!!!  Duh!!!!!  I was so pissed!!  Never again will I ever come back here!!!  They can get lost, better yet close down for all I care!!!

96IE7OpWFFkFPlrmpVOWvQ.text: This was the original banh mi spot in Las Vegas...however, seems like they switched owners recently, but I could be wrong.  The menu has changed a bit, but not by much.  This is the only place I know that has lupcheong banh mi sandwiches, in addition to other flavors.  Its hard to go wrong with banh mi sandwiches, but I am not a fan of dry french bread that saws the palette of your mouth. Yikes.  Still, I gotta go with the old trusty grilled pork or chicken with pate.  I could do with a little more pickled shredded daikon with carrots, but it never seems to be enough.  All in all, this place is cheap and can hit the spot.  Close to the UNLV area and seem to catch the youngsters in there along with the general masses.  That goes to show that this place still maintains its clientele well.

vg6zVOiPch4zi87PFGZoEQ.text: This place is perfect on a hot summer day and after a long cross country drive.  The banh mi and the rice rolls definitely hit the spot after seeing hours of subway sandwich shops fr Canada to Cali.  Thank goodness for Pho Tranh!

-jm8JlGQtH6_fUK1jKIllQ.text: Always go here for take out when I'm feeling home sick with my partner. she loves the Banh mi thit nuong (grilled pork sandwich which is my fav) and Cha Gio(fried mince pork rolls) Yummy.

SooE9JZOJO-W9M4nQJ98Ow.text: Great food! Pho tasted great. Ordered the beef sliced steak pho. Also the place is smoke free for those who are interested. Very spacious parking and room for groups. Also much cheaper than eating pho restaurants at the strip

Fr_utTfXPQe4qqTELjwn4g.text: Excellent place for soup, i've been to a lot of places in the search for the best pho soup. I found this place around a year and a half ago and don't go anywhere else, customer service is great...in there so often we don't even have to order, the lady remembers or order right down to the scoop of rice. Its greatly priced kind of far to drive but its worth ever minute of the drive.

HfLyK4-P0VqBOG--fvzT8g.text: Pretty tasty food and friendly staff members too. I had myself a bowl of pho and other people who were with me ordered a egg noodle dish, plus a rice dish. Most of the dishes there remind me of home cooking, so if you're craving something simple and some home cooking, this is a good place to start!

t6mkd7Oh6DUz-Tpihp_cfA.text: I stopped at this place for lunch every chance I get. Close to the airport and next to the Las Vegas strip. Every time, my regular go to is the Vietnamese egg-rolls and Pho special. And always take to go is the sandwich for later. This place have not failed me yet with the foods. Portion is large and the price is reasonable.The restaurant is nice and clean, friendly staff and plenty of parking. Definitely will visit again.

k6GUYbkT3NXumG5KklnlWg.text: BEWARE OF THIS RIP OFF RESTAURANT! Our family of 3 people had dinner at this restaurant last Monday 11/19/18.    After ordering our food, we had to wait for almost 1 hour when they brought out a bowl of "pho" to my husband while my brother & myself were still waiting for our 2 sandwiches as our dinner.  Even when my husband finished eating his "pho" there was still no sign of our sandwiches even though we kept checking with the waitress.  Finally, they brought the "banh mi thit" to our table, but by then it was almost 9:30 p.m. (after 1 and 1/2 hours waiting for it) & too late for us to eat there so we had to take the food home.  When I went to the cashier to pay for our food, we were charged 3 sandwiches instead of the 2 that we've ordered.  If I didn't pay attention to the bill & catch their mistake, they would have cheated us the cost of the 3rd sandwich that we didn't ordered & they didn't bring to our table. Then on Saturday 11/24/18 we went back to this establishment with the family of my daughter including 2 small children of 8 & 5 years old.  The food was mediocre where they charged us $4.00 for 2 extra eggs for a rice dish.  My 8 year old granddaughter wanted a small bowl of just the beef stew broth (no meat) & a roll of bread.  When I went to pay at the cashier, I've discovered that they have charged us $13.95 for this small bowl of beef stew broth without any meat.  When I questioned her about this ridiculous charge, the cashier informed me that even though we did not want any meat, they would still charge us full price for this dish. This is an unbelievably rip off, terrible & unethical practice of doing business at this restaurant.  Had the waitress informed us in advance that they would charge us the full price when we ordered this dish for the kid, we would have never ordered it in the 1st place.  Who, in the right mind, would want to pay almost $14.00 for a lousy small bowl of just broth & bread.  Furthermore, their service was slow & unfriendly.  We would NEVER GO BACK to this restaurant again to be victimized the 3rd time.  You're better off going to other Vietnamese restaurants in town as there are plenty of them in Chinatown & elsewhere in Las Vegas.  Don't let them cheat & rob you!  Their lousy food is not worth it!

qSFP8ACFraYDIZXnl7X9Vw.text: Within the past five years that I have been an occasional customer I have never experienced any issues with this place. Each time I went in they were slow, which is a big plus for me because food comes out faster that way. I always ordered their chicken pho and asked for white meat only. It's a mix with white and dark meat so if you're not a fan of either the two you could just let your server know, and they'll leave it off. Their bahn mi and egg rolls are super good and affordable! I think this is a very good and convenient pho spot besides traveling to China town. Average price for two pho's and a spring roll would be roughly around $26-$28 with tax.   Also, careful around the restaurant. There's a lot of solicitors there, they come in and talk to the customers and some of the servers ask them to leave but the others don't interfere as much. You'd have to shoo some people away while you're trying to eat LOL

z4ageiFIwb3GeMVIsBULUg.text: Good service but pho broth a hit or miss.  Sometimes broth had too much msg. Visited this restaurant for lunch and dinner several times before posting this review.

71WmIXkV7_zjPAKrkGgXCQ.text: Really tasty pho! We ordered number 11 which is the combo pho bowl and it was very good. The service was really nice although a little unorganized. I would come back for sure!

NtHJEO2rv2yFlwRpGyj4Tw.text: My family loved the banh mi's here! Their other dishes were really good as well. We definitely enjoyed our lunch here and will be back to take some banh mi's on the trip back to Utah.

FlEuD44VrweFaDl5PCi9Zg.text: Nice little find on the corner of Tropicana and Maryland parkway. I've been here many times and always walk away satisfied. Really tasty Pho with many meats and veggies to choose from. Several different bahn mi sandwiches plus many other tasty dishes. My favorite is the marinated pork bahn mi with extra meat and add extra basil, sprouts and fresh jalapenos. That's how I roll there! Speaking of rolls, grab an extra roll (they're good) to go with a steaming bowl of Pho and you'll be a happy person. Bon Appetit!

hMoLrotYJGKnOMMVk3c_Rw.text: I can't believe the service. So kind, patient and reasonable. The food is even better or just as good as the people. I come back time and time again and although it may be slow on busy days, their attitude and kindness blows me away enough that i dont mind being patient myself :) always returning!

45qVNgufWh6O-94OyL3Yow.text: Pho Thanh Huong is another decent local favorite. They have been in business for decades. PTH get my respect besides their food is their integrity of hiring nearby college students. Like the name indicated. Their Pho is as good as the ones found in Little Saigon of Anaheim, Orange County.

photos.caption: Photo of Pho Thanh Huong - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Very easy to find: Near UNLV, Hooters n MGM.
Photo of Pho Thanh Huong - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Special Rice Combo!

4Y46CLOKJse7tdg2h4bSZw.text: Pretty solid pho/Vietnamese restaurant. One reviewer said they smelled acetone from the nail salon next door. But yet, the minute I walked in, I got a strong, disgusting wift of stale cigarette smoke. =/ I continue to smell that throughout my dinner. That nasty Dotty's dump next door must be the culprit.   I'll definitely say this: at $8.50 a bowl of Pho Tai, it was on the pricey side....especially since this place is not even located on the strip!!! Pho So 1 doesn't even charge that much!!! Pretty awesome pho though, I have to admit.  So my boyfriend and I each got a bowl of pho and he ordered the grilled pork banh mi which only cost $3.50. Awesome price for a very flavorful, charboiled pork sandwich. YUM!!!!! I can tell this would be perfect for UNLV students, since this restaurant is close by. The sandwich was delicious, decent sized and it was cheap.   We came for dinner on a cold, rainy Monday night. Plenty of seating available, we were serviced right away and the food arrived within 3 minutes. Restaurant was clean (to the naked eye that is...) and what I loved most were the individually-wrapped bamboo chopsticks. I like those because these were a one-time use only. (you know how some Asian restaurants can be when it comes to cleanliness.) Solid restaurant for pho and that dang delicious grilled pork banh mi if you're ever on this side of town.

uNDtXkDmgiZTZIhpw1e2Zg.text: Ok this food may have been a little "too" authentic for me. I may have imbibed a bit much the night before but hey it's Vegas.  I wanted a nice Vietnamese combo plate to soak up the night's alcohol. I couldn't even explain what came on the plate - greasy sausage of some sort, a bit of greasy short rib and some other seafood something. The spring rolls were mostly iceberg lettuce (super weird) and not appealing. This was a bitter disappointment

fhDcL80a30YISSeE1aSUlg.text: Great food and great customer service. There were a lot of customers at. The time I was there, but they didn't let wait very long and food came out fast too. Most importantly my mom loved the food, and this will be our spot now when we want to eat Pho!!!

4PE4PH7DK5oGgssSNTAmNA.text: The food is absolutely delicious, but the service is what's preventing me from coming back. We live in Summerlin and just to eat here, we'd take the drive. We haven't gone back for a week because the same thing always happens to us. One time we were seated and not given menus. When our orders are taken, the waitress clearly writes everything down, but somehow we end up with the wrong dishes? Last time we were here we ordered fried egg rolls that didn't come out for 25 minutes, but when we asked about them the girl was clueless and brought fresh spring rolls instead that were for the table next to us. My sister sat with her pork chop plate for 15 minutes without the fish sauce and utensils to eat. I was served my banh xeo plate without the fish sauce and utensils as well.

QNrWwKclEFhQRYbupBGl6g.text: Fantastic broth, wonderful service and very very clean kitchen. Staff is happy and enthusiastic.

lBfj5c_Et9wDFIBvB6uqyQ.text: I like this place! Absolute favorite comfort food, and they have no problems with packaging with extra vegetables. The bread is fragrant and always fresh. If you like this, then you will like this place!

0lzcxQRq8lGp4PWZ5Kx0cQ.text: Drug test your employees/Owner... ordered to go/Take Out,  came to hotel to eat, ,. WTH all orders were Wrong.  FuK yu  NOT COMING BACK

uZBfVhBQyeJELm1z2enR0w.text: Ok more like 3.5 stars.   I try to be as impartial as possible when trying a new place, but I'm not quite sure what's going on with this place. We arrived around 12:30pm and expected a lunch rush. The place was mostly empty, maybe 6 tables out of 17 had customers dining. With two other parties in front of us, we were told we had to put our names on a list and wait to be seated. It only took 5 minutes to be seated, but given that so many tables were empty, waiting at all seemed odd.   The hostess is very friendly and delivered menus and took our order quickly. We ordered pho and a bahn mi sandwich and were given the usual plate of condiments to go with it, but it was missing the Thai basil and cilantro. When we asked about it, the server said they recently started omitting these items from the plate and only served them if customers asked. So that is a little weird to me too.   My dining companion was served her soup several minutes before my sandwich came out, which is also when the iced coffee I had ordered at the start came out. Also weird.   But as for the food, the bahn mi sandwich rolls are HUGE. Like...American football sized. And they are GOOD! They were a little skimpy on the jalapenos, but I understand not everyone has a mouth made of asbestos like mine.   All in all worth it for the food, but the service is just a little weird, which is the only reason for the 3 stars.

eH6b-ptuOWU7XqWD6VQ_pA.text: Another delicious Pho. Wow. This time I was smart and ordered 2 pork Bahn Mis!  As usual, the staff is super nice.

Kza1FFU3nzdiKdrW55Ig0g.text: Great service. The food is excellent and the shakes phenomenal. Great place for date night. You get your food fast and has a great atmosphere.

UpeB_5Gg405FpPH3Ijs7rA.text: Given that I work at the school, I come here pretty often. The food is always good, consistent, and the servers are quick and friendly.  I don't think I've ever had anything less than delicious here - which is why I keep coming back!

GixGlflEDKbLfIY8WoKlEg.text: I used to go to this place all the time as a student at UNLV and the former owners were RUDE and so I never went back until ~2 years later, which was a few nights ago.  To my delight I came to find out that there are NEW owners/management that are extremely pleasant and helpful.   I got pho there, which is actually really good. There is a combination bowl and it has tons of items in it: tripe, beef balls, brisket, flank, etc. And it's a flat rate at $8.50.  They said that if you don't like any one of those items, they remove it and add more of what you do like.  So I was definitely happy with that because I really don't like tripe.   It's hard to find places that are not in chinatown that have good pho. This place is one of them.   I also tried their grilled pork sandwich and it was delicious! The bread is made in-house and I was told that they make it fresh daily around 9-10AM. I love bread and I'm picky hhaha but it was really good with their grilled pork and veggies.   LEMME say, that I will admit that their grilled pork sandwich is WAY better than Lee's sandwiches! :) Yes, I said it. & Its True!   I'm a happy camper now that I can go back to this place whenever I'm on campus and know that the staff are super friendly and that they have really good food.

-tNqcTzCnbVEAQqbAMBgyg.text: wow, as often as I come here, the mother and son team know us and what we like as soon as we come walking in.  I've gotten to know the mom that owns the place pretty well- she is a very nice lady but it helps to be pretty fluent in Vietnamese.  What can I say about the place- it has no atmosphere and the service is quite lacking but she makes one hell of a banh cuon.  If you don't know what banh cuon is, its rice rolls filled with ground pork, a type of fungi and seasonings...each roll is hand rolled..why do I know this? My mom makes some of the best in San Francisco...so when I come here and am craving my mom's banh cuon, this is pretty darn close.  They come out warm and gooey on a plate with bean spouts, cha lua ( vietnamese sausage) and veggies....  That is what brings me back again and again...and their sandwiches are pretty darn good too...their Pho is a hit or miss and some days I feel like I'm back home at my parents house when the kitchen and wait staff are yelling at each other...but oh well- I come for the food, not the service!

Teg7zF6ZvvybeAO6Al-_Zg.text: This is one of the best places to go for Pho in Vegas. Had beef stew, fried chicken wings & fried rice with ham and sausage. Good price and yummy!! Friendly people too!

1gSAc--0KX41HQbDuoDXWg.text: They remodeled, wow, apparently 9 months ago?  Banh mi is now $3.25 each, $3.50 total with tax. So hungry after studying at Lied, I inhaled my BBQ pork banh mi; so delicious with crispy bread, warm meat, sweet mayo, pickled veggies, and just a hint of heat from jalapenos....I bought the egg and Chinese sausage one ($3.50 +tax) for my roommate but can smell it in my bag, so it might not last the rest of my study session....haha, glad to have a reason to come back to this place, and I'll be back again!!

qx0rErH2nYDCDgogPOgCJA.text: First time trying Vietnamese. The food here was awesome! Staff were wonderful and the food was so cheap. The sandwiches were very tasty!

7KMSIqOatJzlBZIo47uv4w.text: My go to, favorite place to get banh mi! I always get the grilled pork banh mi and sometimes Thai tea and it never ever disappoints!

UkHVFrx-E4O7AuyT47L0bQ.text: After searching for a quality bowl of pho near UNLV for some time, I stumbled upon this gem. For around $10 I got a big bowl of noodle pho and a grilled pork bahn mi sandwich, both of them delicious.  The place is nothing special to look at, but the food is what matters, and this restaurant hits home on the flavor front. For the price and quality, I have not found a better Vietnamese restaurant outside of Spring Mountain Road.

zxUnKSOguojLoTJA8f16Vw.text: Located right next to UNLV, and is a place where many college students come for a cheap and well cooked meal. The food here is pretty good, but I heard the banh mi here is the best thing there is. The customer service here was really good as well, we came in a large group and they efficiently handled everything. They tried their best to help us out and were very humorous, the waiter was really nice and communicative. I would recommend this place to others!

qLyAwyZclkFz2vZzENBqgg.text: I love the sandwiches here!  I always get the pork. Wish they had beef, but pork's pretty awesome, too.

g954XKfktUsrLgxJjDtVig.text: I have to agree with Hiro 100%, this place smelt very funny definitely a cigeratte smell probably from the bar two doors down. But the smell alone will make this my second and last visit here.  But I still think they deserve three stars because the food was fairly good. Had a order of fresh spring rolls and pho both very tasty, but I can't get over to smell to find it in me to come back.

lHpItxmd_4PLlSwrzG7fnA.text: Banh mi (Vietnamese subs) are not the norm around my side of town, but since this is near school and doesn't require a detour from my normal routes, It hits the spot.   Was craving a BBQ Pork sandwich, loaded with vegetables including cucumbers, carrots and the white one (which is so honestly called "white carrot" when translated my way) and Cilantro!   Delicious, friendly staff and the bread comes out warm (possibly due to heating in a conventional oven before the goodies are inserted) but still nonetheless satisfying. I prefer this style of banh mi versus the Lee's baguettes or any baguettes for that matter since they're much tougher and tend to shred the top of my mouth.   Definitely recommended, but will have to try other dishes when I am inclined to do so. :)

3AuAtjwEOCw4lgZ6eMuZKQ.text: The proximity of this restaurant and the Banh Mi are the home-runners for me.  Thank the Yelp gods for this small gem! During the four years of attending UNLV, I would've been delighted to know there was such a yummy Vietnamese restaurant just across campus. There has been numerous times I craved pho or banh mi but did not have the 10-15 minutes to drive to Chinatown.  I had some bad experiences with previous pho restaurants regarding service, but this place is great. No need to wave down waiters to get a refill for my drink. Also the venue is clean and tidy.  I had the fried egg and Chinese sausage banh mi. The bread is toasted nearly perfect. It is crunchy yet crumbles away effortlessly, almost just melting away in your mouth. No need to chew and bite endlessly like with the bland toasted bread from Subway. Damn, did I just compare this place to Subway? Yeah right. Anyways, the fried egg and Chinese sausage was great, just a little too salty. I would definitely tell them to hold the salt next time. However, only $3.50 for this tasty sandwich? I can roll with that any day!  My girlfriend had the vegetarian pho and the broth looked and tasted spectacular. I really dislike how some pho are served drenched in oil. I hate seeing pockets of oil floating around in my broth, yuck! Thankfully, the broth was very clean and tasty. Maybe because it was vegetarian pho the broth was clearer than usual. I normally have beef or shrimp pho, so next time I will try that.  In conclusion, I really like the location of this venue and the banh mi. Definitely recommending this place, not only because location but for its surprisingly tasty dishes as well.

F5AYHO_aAGBAf5x4SmLSRQ.text: On a quick three night trip to Vegas and tired of strip food. So off to yelp for something different. Wow did we find different. Would have never walked through the doors of this place but all the great reviews made us take a chance. Sure glad we did. The wife got the PHO I got some beef and shrimp plate over rice and egg rolls. Everything was amazing. We will definitely be eating here on are next trip to Vegas. It's in a very sketchy strip mall. But once inside it is very clean and neat. The prices are low for the amount of food you get.

faQCMlXKb9dHixXxSLI71w.text: Sandwiches!!  Dude, this is my favorite banh mi place evoooooore! It's really inexpensive and the ingredients are super fresh.  The bread is freshly made, and they have a ton of selections. I really like the chinese egg and sausage banh mi and the charbroiled pork one. MMMM! The sandwiches are about $3-$4, so it's handy for broke college students like myself (also located across the street-ish from the Trop garage of UNLV). I've had pho from here too, and it was pretty decent, but I usually just go for banh mi.  The soup was just cause I was sick that day and had to study haha. Still tasty nonetheless.   Downsides: This place smells like smoke! gaaah, horrible.  I recommend taking your food to go, unless you like the taste/smell of carcinogens with your food.  Also, the service when you're seated is kinda slow.  I drink a ton of water and the refills didn't come quick enough after I loaded my sandwich with Sriracha.  Plus, they don't really have consistent waiters or whatever.  It's like everyone is doing everthing? I'm not sure. Personally, that's not really a big deal for me since I feel like most authentic Asian restaurants have that same kind of attitude, but sometimes people wanna be dined for real so be cautious 0.0   Overall, I'd definitely come back...and back...and back again.  It's tasty, low cost, and it's right by school, which is the biggest seller for me.  It's something different from Chipotle or whatever is around campus.

Jr6PwFAr2nBMF4dgCIwGHg.text: Located right across UNLV next to Von's. I actually really like their pho here, it reminds me of the yummy pho places I'd go to in the Bay Area in California. So whenever I'm craving for good pho, this is my spot! Also, their Banh mi is yummmmy! Ugh, the baguettes are perfectly crispy and soft at the same time and their ingredients are fresh, plus the meats aren't dry. I've tried their bbq pork and their baked chicken and they were both great! What makes a great Vietnamese sandwich is their baguette and some places lack that, this spot doesn't! The only thing is that it's a bit pricey here, but you won't be disappointed, it's worth it :))

iGaHuzENbBj7s9sTSE-Lug.text: Love this place, I always walk over here for lunch from UNLV and it's a much better value and healthier option than a lot of other places around here. As many others have said, the #57 banh mi is delicious!

p5TqVKQJWhwrVS_OH9f1yQ.text: This is a hidden gem very close to the Vegas Strip.  Incredible service and good Pho soup base.  They have the viet famous grilled bun with pork.  The smoothie is a bit too milky for me but the salted lime with soda taste fabulous!

f7RTxRacqx-AHE8M97z6PQ.text: Holy Banh Mi Batman!  I've been a fan of Mr. Sandwich for a long time, but a couple of impromptu lunches here and I am now sold! I'd never heard of this place. It's in an unassuming strip mall off Trop and Maryland.  It's a nice clean restaurant! The first time, I got pho and a banh mi. Second time, I got the banh mi.  The bread is perfect. Crunchy, chewy, delicious all at the same time. Priced well at about $3.75 per sandwich.   You can be a fatboy like me and just get two sandwiches, but call it a day after that. It's still pool season.  One of my new favorite off-site lunch locations!

7O922uvmF_crIejAaf6tqA.text: I go here when I'm desperate for a quick Vietnamese sandwich.  I don't know what happened but when that place changed management and painted the restaurant it has the most horrible stench in there.  I can't tell if it's cigarette smoke, and at first I thought it was just lingering from a smoker but it's been months and the past 4 times I've been there, it smells horrible.  Unless you don't care about smell when you eat (which I'm pretty sure I'd rather smell roses than cigarettes when I eat) then eat here. But if you care, then find a new place and tell me about it.  I honestly had to wait outside while I waited for my sandwich.  Harsh? Yikes. Sorry. It's the truth  (I hope some worker there sees this and fixes this problem. Yes, I have mentioned it to them before but I don't know how helpful it was)

vGeZoj_z6dGUuh1LgdLhsg.text: This is definitely a gemstone! They are serious about their foods! My favorite is Banh Xeo. It's by far the best Vietnamese crepe I've eaten. It far surpassed the ones in Westminster California. They make it big and put many things on it such as shreded squid/octopus (?), pork belly, yellow beans, bean sprouts, etc.. U guys definitely should try this one!

oH8CuqevqpA-6TDPBT4vZA.text: Food is delicious! The Pho is so flavorful and so many different options for broth and choices of toppings. Their sandwich selection is also great! When the bread is fresh first thing in the morning it tastes so delicious! Only thing that stops from getting 5 stars is service after you get your food gets a little sloppy.

e7KwGV6Eizb_dRJsd8mzVg.text: Bbq pork sandwiches are on point and affordable. Pho is above avg according to the many I visted across the US. I like the fact that they make their own buns and always taste fresh

an8TaNaffGK7Ktcr7U2S2w.text: Great bahn mi sandwiches. I like the beef wrapped onion the best but also the egg and sausage or the grilled beef is good too.

tnhnjyNKMNutI7spJFuaIQ.text: Visiting Las Vegas and came here for dinner. The pho and ban mi is SUPERB! Great place to eat! 5Stars

fXXrIYXwQCwtzClCqfWMOA.text: One star just because their banh mi suck now. They switched ppl like 8 months ago and it was a guy who used to make them now it's a girl. Skimpy on the meat, skimpy on the veggies, tastes like cardboard because of not enough spread. Don't bother asking for extra it costs a dollar. For literally 2 cents of veggies. That is almost a 30% increase in price.  Still can't beat the 3.50 though but terribly disappointing slide in quality of food. Pho is alright. tastes like it's got msg in it, gives my wife and I a headache so we always go for the banh mi here. Usually good service. We used to come here 4-5x each month. Hopefully management reviews this page and implements some quality control. Check out the unappetizing photos. Really hope they taste better soon.  - edit : have since returned, bang mi quality control has improved somewhat and they still have fairly quick service. Good to grab as a to go item and sometimes I get one before hopping on a plane. Otherwise the pho is fairly decent.

photos.caption: Photo of Pho Thanh Huong - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Tastes like cardboard. Why have such a large piece of bread?
Photo of Pho Thanh Huong - Las Vegas, NV, United States

qlFOVUUgppy2y63a0Y00vA.text: If you're on the strip and you're looking for some of the best Pho' or Bahn mi, you needdddd to come down here!! 10 or of 10!!!

Rvl7eLiHmFBie8wqWz6a4Q.text: I've had their vermicelli and rice dishes so far.  Not a bad place to come for a quick Vietnamese fix but probably not that best place. Come to think of it, I don't have a discerning palate for the Vietnamese cuisine.  I can say that it's not the best or the worst.  All Vietnamese food is good and meets standards if I don't have food coma because of the msg loaded entrees.  I would recommend their bread. I thought it was good and I would say I'm a bit of a bread expert.

photos.caption: Photo of Pho Thanh Huong - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Grilled pork chops

mVjnD1fY37gulnomqIsA_Q.text: One Of best Pho Place in the East side of town!  Combination Pho is what I always get here.  Broth is flavorful and not oily.  The meat is always tasty and fresh.  Grill pork sandwich is sensational as well!

xpjWlty-lIjyMyWUMATYxA.text: In the mood for pho but dont want to take that long drive to china town ? This place is it ! Very good food fresh and friendly servers. Usually no crazy wait for a table and clean and family friendly atmosphere. Only reason I gave it 4 stars is because when it is busy sometimes the servers kinda of forget certain things like the drinks, Ive been there three times before i write my review and same so I figured its just them not the day. We would order hot tea or a boba and we needed to remind them about it eventually we would get our drinks but by the time we were finished with our food. Unfortunately well just stick to water haha but besides that I like this place ton of parking outside also. Definitely will be back !

hsjzA57Ko2EuSD14kb5Hiw.text: We have been on a pho quest, trying out different places and this place was excellent!! Service was good, food was great! We had the #11 and #14 seafood and beef pho which was very fresh. You can even customize your bowl! Would definitely come back here again!!

hsbKbf8JFkKK2R8YXaeZRw.text: I love this pho restaurant.. it is family owned and every time we go the food is consistently great..

photos.caption: Photo of Pho Thanh Huong - Las Vegas, NV, United States

gEwTxk_RfqjVgUvzouR9ZQ.text: Fast and friendly service! The food was pretty good too! I'm vegetarian so it was nice that they offer veggie broth. The Thai tea was really good too. Will definitely come back!

E5QaBJTX1_nbJFu_eoGRiQ.text: The wife and I stopped in for lunch. I had the pho and the wife had the Banh Mi Thit Nuong pork sandwich.  The pho was some of the best I've had. Plenty of noodles and vegetables in a wonderful beef broth. It was fantastic.  The pork in the sandwich was to die for! My wife said that it had just the right amount of spicy and sweet. It had a great smokey flavor as well. The service was good and the restaurant seemed to be very clean. The prices are very fair, especially for the sandwich. Loved it!

XE-8Ltscgc9qsYdjVVKA2A.text: Terrible service. We were there for an hour and our food still didn't come out. We ended up leaving before the food came out. They NEED MORE WORKERS!!!!!!

bwHe2QsDBwRsDl4Et2TSYg.text: Such a cute little low key spot. I have eaten Pho all over including in Los Angeles where the Pho is ridiculous and I will say this is on my top 3 Pho restaurants to eat at!

_OTObXa3HWfy9p16N98saw.text: I really wanted bun rieu and decided to give Pho Thanh Huong a try.  I didn't care for it.  The flavor is not strong enough.  The color was way too light to be called bun rieu.   I didn't see much rieu but a hodge podge of other ingredients.  There was a crab claw in there that I didn't even bother to taste as I don't know how long it has been frozen.  The pork hock was super tiny.  I decided to make bun rieu last weekend just because of my disappointment at Pho Thanh Huong.  I also got a grilled pork banh mi to-go, which was decent.  Service was good.  But, there is plenty of better restaurants so I won't be returning.

jtyYL62MyCpm6xdWwTJ4lA.text: I decided to give this place a second chance.  Usually I come here for their Bahn MI's as they are delicious, but I decided to try something different.  I got the fresh spring rolls and the combo vermicelli bowl with BBQ pork and egg rolls.   I'm still dissapointed in the spring rolls. The ingredients are fresh but the pork itself is super dry and flavorless. I do like their peanut sauce, but I wish it was a little thicker as it's hard to use as a dipping sauce.   I did like the vermicelli bowl, I am not a fan of shrimp, but I loved these ones as they seemed grilled and marinated. The pork was tender and had a delicious marinade, and the vermicelli freshly made.   I however did not like the egg rolls. The texture on the inside was mushy and flavorless, and I wish in my vermicelli bowl that the fresh veggies were not under the warm vermicelli.   But still their Bahn MI's are delicious

dv_Hitlym-8lCpsRv9bxkg.text: Everything's so expensive compared to others Asian restaurants that I have been in Las Vegas , Ph shouldn't be 11.50 up to 14 to fifteen dollars average of $9.50 to $10.50 except for the regular sandwich... even with beef sandwich is 9.95 that's too expensive.... it will be my last time to come to this restaurant....

_vDEWKo-FwprmoRdffWgAg.text: Grilled pork Banh Mi was amazing!!! We ordered take out and it was fast service. Thank you again!

1cPa0CTq-CzIRsQab8SVpg.text: Our family came here because of the star rating but I have to say I'm very disappointed with the service. I would never come back. The service was very slow. I ordered the Vietnamese coffee and it's not even good. Terrible!!!

jDxjArHFop9cTyKlOL3arQ.text: This restaurant is so underrated in terms of popularity around my circle of friends (not a lot of people I know come her but now they will!!!).  This may be unusual but I appreciate a spot with good water. Most places in China Town have water that taste too... chemically. They have the best asian restaurant tap water and that means a lot. Clean, yummy water means clean pipes and cleaner foods.  I applaud this place.

mGDIkT2378lm9i3xUBw_hg.text: We normally stop here for our pho fix when visiting Vegas and after trying other places out, this is one of the better pho places in Vegas. The pho and bun bo hue are both good.   The sandwiches here are so good here! The cold cuts and the egg and Chinese sausage sandwiches are the best. I really think the bread is what also makes it so good. The bread is fresh and perfectly crispy!  The service is always great. The employees are always friendly and patient.

photos.caption: Photo of Pho Thanh Huong - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bun bo hue

wP31Y5fL0PBtXjCKrfctUg.text: Service: 1 star, super slow service, gave us straws but our water didn't come out until after we finished our meal and reminded them about it, another table that came after us got their bowl of pho first (we had the exact same order), had to wait over 20-25 minutes for food to come out, had to wait another 7 minutes (reminded them 2x) after pho was served to get small bowls (never got the scissors ) for kids even after we specified this while ordering. Even with all the bad service, not once did they apologize.   Pho: 1 star, broth didn't have much beef taste to it, only a few pieces of meat in the bowl, not much noodles either, had to order another entree to be full due to the small pho bowl.   Rice with pork chops: 4 stars, among the various entrees we got, this is the only thing worth ordering again if I ever go back. Though I think my family will rather wait in line at Chinatown next time.   Price: 1 star, overpriced for what we got.   Overall, 2 stars. Most likely won't be coming back.

fdbm3sDlytVJu29fpLB5mA.text: Coming in, I was a little confused. I didn't know if it was seat yourself or get seated by the server/hostess. No one greeted me to sit down so I just sat myself. Service was ok, food came out extremely fast, but it was pretty good food. I ordered pho with meatballs & tendon and a Thai tea with boba. Not even 5 minutes after I ordered the pho it already came out. I don't know if they just keep a pot of broth out boiling all day or what. The meat ratio to noodles and soup was extremely off. I had probably about 5 pieces of meatballs and 3 pieces of tendon; the size of the bowl was decent so I expected a little bit more meat. The Thai tea was good, though. Tastes just like any other good Thai tea, but the boba was a little hard.  If you're in a rush & need a quick meal to get in, this is the place to go.   The meal was about 13$ not too bad of a price.

nBeuEAJt9bcARULI_ccHQg.text: I am the biggest foodie when it comes to anything Asian cuisine due to growing up with Japanese/american style dishes. With this being said, I'm a frequent visitor of Chinatown. However, China town is about a twenty minute drive and i'm a broke college student so i needed something a bit cheaper, delicious and more convenient. Besides Hue Thai which is literally my favorite place in Vegas, this place is in my top 5.   Whenever, i go into the shop, I'm greeted by all of the staff and depending on if i'm eating in or taking it to go, they are very quick and attentive. I've tried both the charbroiled pork and grilled beef banh mi and they are completely packed with flavor. The cooks here really do it well. They pack the sandwich with the right balance of spicy and sweet from their mayo sauce, daikon , and carrot to their smoky meats and jalapenos.  Depending on what you get, most of the sandwiches are around 3.75+tax with the exception of beef at $8...  Also, if you're looking for bubble tea, please don't get it here! The boba itself is bitter and way too chewy but the tea is excellent. I'd recommend any of the teas without boba.  The place is clean, convenient, and quiet. Also for my fellow poor UNLV students, they offer discounts and are super close to campus. In fact, they are right on Tropicana and Maryland next to Vons in the mini strip mall!

-ZvgzDQ1I4H1Ed14xUTCFQ.text: The Pho here is really good. The staff was super friendly. The fresh spring rolls are very dry.   Tips using credit/debit cards- no percentage options says good, great or excellent. You select one and it adds money to your bill. I think great is 20%.

mRIHEReKG1Kb2tDMo0spZg.text: We stopped by here since we were dropping people off at the airport, and we are always looking for good Pho and Vietnamese sandwiches. Very friendly people working and fast service, noticed first off the place is clean and bright. Wifey had the Chicken with Clear Noodles, which was great. I had the Grilled Beef Sand, it was fantastic. The French roll tasted like it was baked this morning. Great place and recommend.

photos.caption: Photo of Pho Thanh Huong - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Pho Thanh Huong - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Pho Thanh Huong - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Grilled Beef

FxLSiTp83og2ernSlIcKXQ.text: This is a sandwich review. The rest of the menu looks a little too pricey anyway.  This summer, Las Vegas Weekly named the banh mi thit cha as one of the top 10 sandwiches in Vegas. They are dead wrong. The banh mi thit nuong is way better.  Both banh mi thit (please spell it correctly) are $3.25 and both come in a small baguette with pickled carrots and daikon, hot peppers (note from tongue to self: make sure they remove this next time!), and a bunch of some kinda butter or margarine flavor enhancer. The difference is that thit nuong is grilled pork. It has sweetness and all the pork flavor you would expect. The ham, steamed pork, and pate in the banh mi thit cha is all too mild in flavor. Top 10 in Vegas? It might only be top 10 on the restaurant's menu because there's only 10 sandwiches.  Get the banh mi thit nuong. It's not as good as banh mi thit I've had in San Jose, but it'll do for Vegas. Or you might try the banh mi trung chien lap xuong, which I've gotta have next time. Fried eggs with (sweet) chinese sausage? Count me in.

00P4QSifMmGzb_v7Kplz2w.text: Some of the best pho I've ever head. Brisket was quality beef. Best pork egg rolls I've ever had.

M797oT6rkfadhiZdcgfKMQ.text: WOW!  Phenomenal service.  Flavor packed Pho.  Exceptionally clean restaurant.  Decided to give this place a try on a Sunday night since it's just around the corner from me and didn't feel like making the journey all the way to Chinatown.  All I can say is WOW!  Went in there with no expectations and walked away beyond happy.  I moved to Vegas about 4 months ago from San Diego where the Pho shops are plentiful and have tried many in the area since arriving.  Thanh Huong will now be my go to for my pho fix.  The servers were SO nice and prompt with everything.  The pho was not heavy nor was it very bland, it was PERFECT!  You also get the option to build you own pho starting with just the beef broth and the noodles, which is great because you only get what you want in it.  To add to it all, unlike some other pho restaurants in the area this one is CLEAN AND... wait for it... they DO NOT bus an entire table on to a dish-washing cart right in front of you as you are eating.  HALLELUJAH!   This place gets 5/5 because I have eaten at MANY pho restaurants throughout the southwest over the the years and I can honestly say this one is one of my top choices.

YNh3krOf9-UE7k-zjG69rA.text: The gfs and I came here for lunch on a Friday. Overall, we were happy with our food. Decently priced, normal portions, and fast service.  The only con is that there's a stale lingering smell of cigarettes in the air, which I couldn't get used to.  No beuno!

photos.caption: Photo of Pho Thanh Huong - Las Vegas, NV, United States

6jRLVQnlhepBl-hg7oSt8g.text: Pho is alright. Free egg rolls and bahn mi are pretty good especially for the price! Service lacks greatly, didn't get greeted when sat down or any other form of interaction throughout the meal.

OmtDYiXfnS90_qEOT7Gmbg.text: The pho broth tastes like watered down chicken broth from  a can.  Very disappointing.  The rice dishes are a little better.

vo9pzkluH6XacBoRxqgYSA.text: My family and I have been here multiple times, it's always clean never loud and service is great . But plllleease bring back chicken broth! My fiance enjoys chicken broth more than the pork and beef broth.

5D9_L2PLGtZyK2zchpO9UA.text: This pho restaurant ranks among the best we've experienced in Vegas, and California, for that matter. The grilled chicken rice plate, pho dac biet, and seafood pho were all exceptional. There seemed to be great attention to detail, like cooking jasmine rice perfectly, and putting only tender parts of vegetables in the dish.

V-9scu2O_QQa-udhPQvuDA.text: If you're looking for a big delicious bowl of pho, look no further. And when I say big I mean it. Their bowls are huge! And at small price tag. I was definitely a fan of this place. Their broth was perfect. Meat and noodle ratio was spot on. Although I could barely put a dent in my bowl, I savored each and every bite.   My gfs got the vermicelli and a banh mi and they were all fans. The shrimp in the vermicelli were huge! I couldn't believe it. Despite everything being big in portions, when we ordered an iced coffee my cup was filled completely with ice. There was probably 2 big gulps in there. What a rip! Luckily it was tasty and the hot Vegas weather melted my ice rather quickly so I got a little more out of it.   Only complaint is that service is a  little slow. But a okay, I know how to behave in an Asian restaurant. It's about hailing them down for yourself!

photos.caption: Photo of Pho Thanh Huong - Las Vegas, NV, United States

JN6-X6qPvbQGu81hboSclw.text: We always have good food when we go here. The staff is nice, the food is tasty, the portions are large but it's still a good bet. I don't give five stars to any place really, so from me is pretty good.

photos.caption: Photo of Pho Thanh Huong - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Pho Thanh Huong - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Pho Thanh Huong - Las Vegas, NV, United States

GhmcL73HjjBe56SzWLTLNA.text: Typical Vietnamese place in the menu. Pho is outstanding and always have to stop here at least once when in town!  Service is always fast, place is clean, staff is friendly.   Maybe someday ill try something else on their menu.

1xAgIYnqL3Vt694GZzFgvw.text: Excellent vegetarian pho! Broth is light and warming to the soul! Also, egg rolls = bomb town!!!

CpFdcSr1ZwP6f4GrQKaSag.text: I've been to this location twice now and had very similar experiences both times. The service was decent, everyone was very pleasant to interact with. However I ordered a blended smoothie with boba and it came out as I was nearly finishing my pho which was a little frustrating. The pho itself was decent, not amazing, but decent, and the fresh spring rolls were pretty good. Overall a good option for a quick pho fix but there are many other options in town that greatly outshine this particular restaurant for pho.

r65dniHA253doq59ZvqwPw.text: Best Pho Ive come across traveling across America. Ban mi delicious also. You can taste that they make their own bread daily! Yum

rk6YMdwpzLzMfq5-vXMpyw.text: Not sure why this place rates so high with other Yelpers.  Maybe people in Vegas aren't exposed to good Pho like in CA. The dishes here are mediocre at best.

OgFSnXw9i7vHITUDedsmKw.text: My favorite pho place in Las Vegas. The service is very good. Reasonable prices. The atmosphere is chill. I've left happy both times I've been here. The selection is what you'd expect, with the added convenience of the side order menu. Can't complain about the location - right next to UNLV.  Word of advice: the nuoc mam they use is quite strong ;) I like mine strong, but it's not for everybody.

vKsun-gF7ZIgZZh8gb0DHg.text: Love it! Love it! Love it!  Have had the Pho and the amazing Sandwiches. Love the Beef Chow Fun. Today the spicy beef and pork noodle soup. Smashing!

svqHHCmMgPMlgQvdx53N0g.text: I have taken the Pho Beef Noodle Soup for several times,  which named Pho Ga, its noodle is thin and long smooth strips with some fresh chicken and vegetables like bean sprouts, the soup is hot but tastes fresh and salty. Another one I would like to recommend is Chim Cut Chien which is fried quail. The skin of fried quail is crispy, but the meat inside is smooth and tender. And it tastes sweet and salty which is warm and delicious. That is a nice restaurant.

ajDN75HLm9VborCBp0VxtA.text: This place is a gem. The broth is so good. The meat to noodle proportion is perfect. The banh hoi is amazing. My mom ordered it and I was stoked that she couldn't finish it cuz I was debating between that and pho. So I got to taste it. The portions here are huge. The Vietnamese sandwiches are good too. Happy I stumbled upon this place.

vd_YPGjfEPFml5qZK3WGZQ.text: Pho-king amazing. I'm wary of food in Vegas, and this place was absolutely fantastic. I got a mixed seafood pho and it was really good. Pretty easy to get to from the strip, and great service.

9SN5p7MpkZHdXebmjSy0EQ.text: Ok so we went to another Vietnamese place that will not be named last night, and it was awful.  This morning my family was missing rice so they wanted to go to a Vietnamese place that was actually great.  Pho THanh Huong did not disappoint.    We went in around 12 o clock, it was fairly busy but we were seated instantly.  The place was nice and clean, the server was really nice.  He also spoke Vietnamese with my parents which is a huge plus.  We ordered 3 broken rice plates with the grilled pork, the bi, and the pork loaf.  Then we also ordered a plate of the shaken beef, and the grilled pork.  We finished the order with 2 glasses of orange  juice and three glasses of iced coffee.  The food and dirnks came out about the same time, and it took about twenty minutes.  our server kept coming back and apologizing to us for the wait.  We were perfectly fine, he was very attentive and overall just awesome.  Major props.  When the food arrived everything was nice and hot.  The pork was sweet and juicy.  The fish sauce that the rice came with was on point, the bi and pork loaf was really well done, and the veggies it came with was crisp and tasty.    In the end, my family really enjoyed the experience of Pho Thanh Huong.  The plates were large and delicious.  This is definitely my go to spot.  Well done to them and keep being awesome!

ulg2SAxJZaFQ-kMC2_IYLQ.text: I've been here multiple times and I always always get the grilled pork sandwich and it never disappoints. The bread is freshly made and the amount of meat filling to veggies is just right and they never short me on the meat! I haven't tried anything else on the menu but this sandwich is a must order.

jYxwuq_mspVU1v2ZoEkf1w.text: This Pho and Vietnamese restaurant in a small strip plaza across from UNLV is just about a 10 minute drive from the Strip.    We went in on Thanksgiving Day, after leaving the airport, at about 2pm and found it not that crowded after lunch.    We were quickly greeted and seated. We ordered some Smoothies with Boba, which were amazing.    Unfortunately, I do not recall exactly what I ordered; however, the taste was great. It was appealing to the eye, tasted great, and the price was reasonable with large portions.  Definitely would recommend.

eobPs9OoHyBaFj-JckTQyA.text: Their pho was on point for me when I first had it which was around opening time but when I went the second time around and this time it was at night towards closing time, their broth wasn't as tasteful and hot. It was warm and bland. However, their grilled pork bahn mi was great!! The bread is the right amount of crisp on the outside and soft on the inside! Had to order some to go!!

kllqnJpn7hbzroCxHMGfzA.text: I called and ordered for pick up for combination pho. Got there in 10 minutes and had to wait another 10 minutes cuz they finally put the order in. There was hardly anyone there so it should've been ready. If anyone know pho, all they need to do is put the broth in the container and the noodles and meat on the side. It shouldn't take that long. However, the broth was tasty. Wasn't bad or wasn't a wow factor either. Next time, I'd probably eat in but there are plenty of other pho places around the area that I'd try first.

e0wWwAKplNvIrxCxUURCkA.text: Everything was delicious! We tried the "create your own Pho combo", sandwiches, and rice combos #27 and 28. My family loved everything! The service was also great!

Kbhlg9rAVf6z9EykEfzRdA.text: I decided to introduce my mom to Pho.  She'd never heard of it and had no idea what she was getting into.  She loves Asian food in general, so I thought we'd give it a try.  I was actually going to go to the Thai place next door, but spied the Pho Thanh Huong and decided to change gears last minute.  The food was wonderful.  I cannot complain about the huge portions or amazing flavors.  The broth in the Pho was some of the best I've had.  The prices were also fantastic.  My one complaint, and the reason for four stars instead of five is the service.  Even though it was 1pm and there were quite a few tables, there was only one server.  He forgot that we'd ordered spring rolls and took forever in bringing our check.  Once the other tables had cleared out, I still had to hunt him down.  Minor in the grand scheme of things.

Ji8Gk3Y8ZZvW2b449JfH8Q.text: I was searching for PHO on this hot day lol and based on the reviews so I decided to give it a try. The restaurant is very clean and tidy. I ordered the spring rolls and a bowl of rare steak pho. My order took a while, at least the pho did. The rolls came out within 5-10 minutes. I was half way through and I heard the microwave being used and I thought why? Lol so probably 5 minutes later my big bowl of soup was served. The steak was a bright red which appears to be fresh, good sign. I add all the side items to it and taste the broth and the flavor was ok, not bad. However it lacked a lot of seasoning. Being that I've lived by naval military bases which are located in a heavily populated Asian community I consider my opinion or rather my palette on the experienced side when it comes to PHO lol just saying lol So anyways, I was disappointed that my broth wasn't like fresher since it cooled down pretty quickly and that took away from the dining experiences with pho. Your mouth experiences heat, flavorful broth, seasoning like Anise, etc and some decent tasting beef. I unfortunately didn't experience that today. It was OK but not the best I've had in a while. Server was accommodating

Sp8cOCdW2aUuibaPDRy56A.text: I love pho :] as much as I love my BF.. or more maybe. hehe just kidding ^_^ We went to Vegas on Thanksgiving weekend with the whole fam.. Ah... Vegas.. what a great place for a family vacay! :P Anyway~~~ We had: - 2x COMBO PHO yelp.com/user_local_phot... - with alllll the meats.. so good.. broth was more clear and so flavorful - SEAFOOD PHO momma enjoyed hers very much :] - EGG ROLLS yummy... but it wasn't hot o.O found out they're left out in trays under the heat lamps.. boo :( - FRIED RICE brother enjoyed his too :] - BAHN MI yelp.com/user_local_phot... wow.. so good.. crunchy bread.. perfectly pickled veggies.. Mmmm.. :) Total: $52ish for 4 people :P Service: friendly people food took a while to come out.. and they brought out one by one O_O oh and that extra plate of sliced onion.. that's a Korean thing right? cuz they sorta looked at us weird when we asked for extra onions on a plate HEHEHE Parking: big lot *Sucky hours. **Good bahn mi.. delicious pho ***Good for large groups :) MmMmm... *burrrrrrrp*

photos.caption: Photo of Pho Thanh Huong - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Pho Thanh Huong - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Pho Thanh Huong - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pho with everything :)

5X9bQ5OB1OKh5VVT6yyYcQ.text: I went here craving pho, and wanted something closer to home than my normal spot. This was a great choice as the pho broth was delicious and flavorful. They have everything you need on the table and they still check on you often. While the pho was amazing, the Thai tea impressed me. Perfect creaminess along with the flavor of Thai tea. Check out was easy because you don't even need to calculate a tip, they have it there for you when you slide your card.

rhgVUiWs9vONJEsDNwoimQ.text: One day we stopped in and ordered a couple of sandwiches and picked up some spring rolls.  It was our first time and we didn't know what to expect.  It turned out to be a good choice.    Since then, we have been back a few more times, even had a sit down and ordered the pho, of course I choose by looking at the pictures and the eye appeal helps me make up my mind, but only once did they suggest that it might be too spicy for me, but once it came out, I loved it!  The crispy bread, the thin strips of meat (pork in my case) and the cilantro and jalapenos make the sandwich!   This a quick in and out with pork sandwich good flavors, but this time our spring rolls were bland without taste, if it weren't for the peanut sauce, it would have been an absolute bland roll.

4SAGQrlLRqu8c5tJb1EzPw.text: I used to frequent this place on occasion because of the location and they offered semi decent food.   However, a couple weeks ago I had one of the worse experiences of my life. I had walked in literally a minute before closing, so they were not the most friendly. However, they still had a restaurant full and if they didn't want anyone to come in, they should have locked the doors. (which they did after I walked in)  I ordered special combo Pho with extra tendon to go along with a grilled pork banh mi. The wait was short and easy. I paid for my food and was on my way home.  Me and my hunny shared the banh mi, which was half ass put together. I had a piece of cucumber which was literally 1/3 of a cucumber that was just thrown on there. And not to mention almost a whole jalapeno that was just on one side of the sandwich. Talk about lazy and no attention to detail.   So after we finish the banh mi, I pour my broth in a pot to warm it up and get it steaming hot so my meat can warm up too. When I go to open the container up, the first thing I look at is my tendon and considering I paid almost $2.00 for extra tendon, I felt ripped off. My rare meat, not even cooked had a light brown tinge to it, which means it was not fresh.   And then to make things worse, two little flies or gnats or whatever they were flew out of the bay leaf and bean sprout pile and completely ruined my appetite.  In utter disgust, I threw it all away and almost felt the need to vomit.  I used to like this place. But now, you will never ever catch me here, no matter how bad I got a craving for Pho or  banh mi.

JeGsLBaS_nmic58fBRvoYw.text: Quick service, great prices, and spot on pho!  The food is southern vietnam style.  It is authentic.

5ARK39crX40YOsk7nKGEYw.text: The food is amazing. I definitely recommend the sandwiches. The water is so good, it makes me wanna dip my whole body in it. Anyways, definitely come try this restaurant. :)

bbY5sPd19wo-iE0VukjveQ.text: Hmmm, where to start. We get to the restaurant and we're seated immediately. I ordered a short rib sandwich and my other 3 friends got pho. When the pho came out, one was incorrect so they let us keep it. We waited 30 minutes for his vegetable pho  and my sandwich which never came out. Once his pho finally came out, there was a huge strand of hair in it. We spoke with the manager Kathy and what she offered us 20% off ($5) our meal. The waiters obviously felt bad and held their head down. The waitress offered something for free to go but Kathy butted in and said no they don't have time. Oh we don't? Okay.  So to conclude, I never got my sandwich, 30 minutes to make vegetable pho, and hair in said pho. Garbage. Save yourself a trip, don't go here.

XHj6z9HqHYxQjh4OnJQcNA.text: I was in town for work and whenever I travel, I always find Vietnamese restaurants to try.  I did a Yelp search and Pho Thanh Huong came up.  I walked in and could smell the anise floating in the air.  I got seated right away and ordered the following:  Meatball pho ($8.50): it was so good!!  Portion was huge, lots of meat and other goodies.    Vietnamese Ham, pork and Pate Banh Mi ($3.25): it was good too, I haven't had one of these sandwiches in a while so it was so good.   I definitely walked out of the restaurant a happy camper.

1MK-CWoIFPGphLAPwqmbIg.text: I really enjoy the pho here and often get it to go for lunch when I'm in the area.The restaurant has upgraded inside and is more warm and welcoming than the plain white walls they had in the past.The people that work there are still very friendly and are more than happy to help answer any questions. They make fresh baguettes there daily, so the bahn mi sandwiches get extra yum points for freshness.   What I like most about this restaurant is that they give plenty of fresh side fixings to go with the pho or noodle soups. Either for take out or dine in, they give lots of bean sprouts, Thai basil leaves, sliced jalepenos, and sliced lime. However, if you do want more chili sauce or hoisin sauce to go, just ask for it. Otherwise, you get one small container of each. The bun bo hue was decent. Not too spicy and had a decent amount of meat. The regular size pho was enough to split for two or one really hungry person. They do offer the King size pho for about 3 dollars more and that can feed 2 hungry people. Don't forget to order their Vietnamese iced coffee to keep the food coma at bay after eating!

rHIPdW98ZyN5kPyh970tuA.text: Went here totally on the yelp reviews.  Feeling the need for Some comfort Pho but making the mistake of walking about 1.5 miles in the desert heat to get there.... arrived about 5 minutes after their 10am opening drenched in sweat.  We were greeted and seated immediately and provided 2 tall glasses of ice water.  Order was taken a few minutes later.    Ordered a Pho dac biet and Bun bo xao, Vietnamese iced coffee.  The coffee arrived immediately, food was a little slow, about 5 minutes for the bun and 10 minutes for Pho.  That's ok because it was delicious.  As were waiting, the restaurant started filling up with other patrons sitting down and also there to pick up to go orders.  After seeing that they bake their own rolls for Banh Mi, we also ordered 2 Banh Mi to go.  The wait was longer on these as there was a steady stream of Banh Mi orders coming in to go!    The servers are friendly, food delicious.  Thanks for directing us here Yelp.

_akRe4waaevaOWZF7p-UDA.text: The pho here is pretty good, but has a lot of MSG in it because I was really thirsty after eating it. We also got the bbq pork banh mi and that was tasty, would recommend ordering.  Overall decent spot for pho and banh mi in Vegas, prices are on the higher side compared to OC, which is expected.

44GH6B6KbbzOpokXXqo0wA.text: I really like the pho and banh mi at this restaurant! The pho is flavorful and can be filled with any type of meat your heart desires. You can get their pho with rice or egg noodles, and their prices range from $8.50 to $11.50 for a large bowl, depending on the types of meats you get in it. For their banh mi, I recommend the grilled pork. But whatever type of meat you get, my personal tip would be to get double meat on your banh mi, it makes it just that much better for just an extra $1.50!   I really recommend this restaurant!

photos.caption: Photo of Pho Thanh Huong - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Two rare beef pho with tripe, a pork banh mi with double meat, egg rolls, all 4/5

LC1t2y0NJQCH2INzagI-OA.text: Ordered the combination Rare & Flank steak Pho to go. It was $10.50. It was super fresh & delicious! I was impressed. I prefer the Rare over the Flank (Flank was a bit too stringy, & not as tasty IMHO) but wanted to try both. I will order the Rare Pho next time. I also picked up a big cup of fresh pomegranate seeds for $6 that they had by the counter. They were great! I was happy they had this. The lady that helped me was nice too. Hopefully everything will be consistent. I'll probably dine-in next time. To be continued...

eJ_BuhHX_E0tBlVaBjRKHA.text: I can't believe I had never been here when I studied at UNLV. Anyways, I came here during my lunch break today and ordered the rare steak pho. Not sure if it was because I was feeling under the weather, but the pho definitely hit the spot! The broth was flavorful enough that I didn't have to add hoisin sauce, and the rice noodles were chewy and amazing!! I'm definitely coming back next time.

DSdNMMqtqWFUdMCYsn9Bvg.text: Place got amazing owner or front C's but food can be better.. pho is meh, spring roll and fried roll meh great Mongolian beef though

SMS7QYzWxLERL5eJam643A.text: one of my favorite places for a quick pho fix! although, delicious and does the trick when having a craving, the broth could use a tad more flavor, BUT compared to many other pho restaurants it has a homey taste. their rice plates are super delicious and i always get their spring rolls and egg rolls. it's conveniently by UNLV (student discount!) and the airport for those who are traveling. when my family visits and gets sick of eating on the strip we come here!

AFd0YaUS1lD2t2LzGa_ukw.text: Overpriced, mediocre sandwiches. The sandwiches are also on the smaller side. Dakao is so much better. I should have driven the extra 10 minutes.

zlabC41j2xI6T3LFPxroSw.text: 4.5 stars  I've tried a couple Vietnamese spots around town, and I gotta say that so far, Pho Thanh Huong has the best pho in Vegas. It's clean yet flavorful, and the noodles have the perfect texture, not too chewy nor too soft. Perfect for a chilly winter day. The egg rolls were really good along with the pork banh mi. They make their own baguettes here, and it was served fresh, had a nice crunch to it.   Service was great as well. Will definitely be back!

_Z17MMGll0qaXHp_g_B9uQ.text: sorry, not sorry for the updated down to a star. not only the prices went up, it's also the poor customer services. I do not know why bother to come back here, twice with disappointments. services were lacking. so one day I ordered meals to go for pick up. ordered over the phone, my husband went there to pay and pick up the foods. the lady at the casher/front was mind spaced or something cause she was rude. my husband is the nicest and calmest person I ever know and he told me about the experience. she was not listening to what he was saying, both in English and Vietnamese! she does not acknowledge that he was trying to tell her to double check if the rice noodles were cooked. no greetings and no smiling from her. anyways, my pho was ok, since it is a to go, I have to reheat the broth. his pho dac biet meat portions was very little for a lot of rice noodles. I'll go farther to get my pho cravings somewhere else.

LZUEjF1ZMoCHY4_AJCbSQg.text: I've eaten here multiple times - for lunch, for dinner, for hangover cure - and the pho is consistently good. The broth has wiped away a few headaches from my brow, and given me peace when i needed it.  I'll continue going here, and bringing my visitors. Great work!!

qf5P0o4QcMCB4Mq9hLuaKA.text: We came here for simple dinner to get away from eating Vegas Strip food. Michelle and I shared a bowl of Pho,  the Lemongrass Chicken and Vietnamese egg rolls.  Restaurant looks clean, simply decorated and has a TV which was playing with no volume. Food came out fast and was very good. Pho came with the usual accompaniments...bean sprouts, jalapenos etc. Prices are very reasonable, service was excellent and the staff was pleasant as well as attentive. We will be back in future Vegas trips

21BL7K1QAsyYQcFKTcULhw.text: Very good Vietnamese food in an area that is not typical. The service is always excellent. My co-workers and I come here for lunch a lot. The baguette bread for the sandwiches is a little softer than typical, but everything from egg rolls, sandwiches, pho, and grilled plates have been really tasty.

qfP49P38qwPhnyip3KMzpg.text: This is my go to, number one pho spot. They always have the freshest veggies and meat. Plus their broth is delicious. The other food I've ordered is delicious too.

4Tdort5NBCDVLLe5hI25dw.text: I would highly recommend this place. Worth the drive. I had the soup with bbq pork and it was excellent. The soup is delicious. Service was friendly.

sVPha3ajaAN_Of7HppURYA.text: I used to come here all the time when I was a student at UNLV. Since I graduated & rarely on this side of town, it's been forever since I've been back.  But 5yrs later, their sandwiches are still delicious & STILL around the $3 price range.. SCORE!!!  I got my sandwiches to-go, and the gentleman making them was super nice & helpful. The grilled pork is only 3.50 and also give a discount to UNLV students. I recently found the grilled beef sandwich which is supper bomb. Check them out if you are in the are you wont regret it.

oPwavBSRF7leh8FZXrT-IQ.text: 4.5 stars!!!  What this place lacks in decor and location it more than makes up for with great Vietnamese food and helpful service.  I came the 3 miles from my hotel to satisfy my yearning for noodle soup (after reading about this spot on Yelp). Even though I arrived after it was closing they served me my Mi Tom Cua (squid, prawn, crabstick and egg noodle) without complaints. Also they let me order a take-out pork sandwich. All for $12.   I loved the fragrant tea so much I bought a pound of it too. Even though I only wanted 1/2lb I didn't make a fuss as the family was so nice.  Come here and try the beef pho (i don't eat much beef so I skipped it) as it looks like the best!
