eIG-1_Ow0LqPowUNv1DsAw.text: I loved this place. So glad the family decide to randomly give it a try. Good food, good service, and very clean. The selections for the banh mi had a lot of varieties- which is great! I had the fried wings for my appetizer- had a nice crisp, and little buttery taste added in. I had a ride dish. The pork was very well marinated. And the dessert was good too- not too sweet and not over iced like most places.   I'm a full, fat, satisfied happy camper!   Highly recommend this place. ENJOY!

photos.caption: Photo of Pho Thanh Huong - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Dessert.. And appetizer. :D
Photo of Pho Thanh Huong - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Great varieties!

a53gGvf2l7z9ZIGa6pv5KQ.text: On first glance, you will notice that the prices are STEEP here.  I mean, 12 dollars for a bowl of pho (large size) is pretty ridiculous.  But, I'm comparing that to southern cali prices and this IS vegas afterall.  After ordering the large bowl of pho, I now I understand why they charge you a pot of gold for it.  The large pho is ridiculously huge, probably one of the biggest bowls of pho I've ever seen.  You can easily feed 3 hungover people on a large bowl.  While it wasn't the best bowl of pho I've ever had, it's decent enough to deliver some nutrients to you're malnourished-starved body after a hard night of partying and some crying in the shower.    3 stars.  Tip: If you need to rehydrate, go ahead and order a fresh coconut here.  It'll run you $4, which is not much for some much needed electrolytes.

photos.caption: Photo of Pho Thanh Huong - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Massive large bowl of pho

zf1fgWOrmIEPMOhqVVrIlw.text: Phenomenal food!! Had the beef ribs and it was cooked and seasoned to perfection!!! Really glad we found this place

c7EVhUgP235AVYhXZwe_fw.text: The bread here has the perfect amount of fluffiness and crunch! I have tried their banh mi several times and the ingredients are always fresh. They use the good soy sauce on the bread. I usually order grilled pork or the cold cut banh mi. My person likes the egg sunshine (egg & Chinese sausage) and/or the sardine banh mi. The thing to do is order extra sandwiches to take home for lunch the next day. Or for a snack later.   The sandwiches are better than those served at most places in Chinatown. If this place were closer to my home/work I would probably go several times a week.  Service is quick and attentive. The servers and hostess are kind and accommodating to even our odd requests. They're on the younger side, perhaps UNLV students? Let's tip them well!

V_aCYCnt5ZYuplQvFoATzg.text: Great bowl of pho, very flavorful!  I had the vegetable pho, lots of crunchy veggies and tasty broth.  My son had the cold noodles dish with chicken and shrimp and said it was delicious.

mUQcz6yUXOkUMe0D7bKxtQ.text: For a pho restaurant it is on point.  The restaurant serve other authentic Vietnamese soups and dishes.  I had Bun Bo Hue soup.  It was decent but nothing outstanding.  The garnish that came with it - cabbage was very bitter.  I believed they may have prepared it too early.  We also ordered Bo Luc Lac (shaken beef steak with rice). This dish was very good.  Pho Bo Vien (pho meat balls) was good.  Yes, I would return.

SFGFBQVfMqzSpctzJ9Tukg.text: *They give a discount to UNLV students with valid ID card*  I enjoyed this place because you can actually create your own Pho. #11. Pho Dac Biet. You get to choose from:  1.) Tai Rare 2.) Nam Flank 3.) Chin Brisket 4.) Bo Vien Meatballs 5.) Sach Tripe 6.) Gan Tendon  You can select all the meats you would like without any extra costs. I like this idea because I usually order a combination pho and catch myself picking out the tripe and tendon.   I have to say the Grilled Chicken Banh Mi was the best Banh Mi I've had in town! The bread was amazing and is a properly made French baguette. It is a must try!  *You also get a free egg roll if you mention Yelp*

U5S4EYz0TMYgoc6qlbeJTA.text: I had the chicken sandwich here. I thought it was very good and the price was very fair. I was open to eating just about anything on the menu, but being so close to the university sometimes can be pricy. So I was mainly there snooping. The dining area was very clean and the staff was attentive, not annoyingly so. It was quick too and the price was right $3.50..

photos.caption: Photo of Pho Thanh Huong - Las Vegas, NV, United States

hGbNhMRBuSC7c52SbVAh6Q.text: I love this place very convenient for students in Unlv!!! Love their variety of Pho!!  I am craving the sandwiches menu. I just tried the banmi yesterday and I actually stopped by after my class to try another sandwich!

photos.caption: Photo of Pho Thanh Huong - Las Vegas, NV, United States

mDnOu9pqJylsrGEDa4qI1w.text: Prompt service, clean restaurant, great wait staff...excellent Pho and Fresh Spring Rolls

-7JmU-44M6_FBhOpSaAEew.text: This place is AWESOME!  From the outside you can't tell how nice it is inside.  The service was excellent and they have a large selection on the menu.  I had the Goi Cuon Fresh Spring Rolls and Pho Dac Biet with Tai Rare Beef and Bo Vien Meatballs and it was excellent.  Those were some of the best Fresh Spring Rolls I've had.  I totally recommend this place!

YqIz5HxbbSWAnIhKM6DcZw.text: They have the best grilled pork banh mi in Vegas by far. The pork is super delicious, the bread is crispy on the outside and soft on the inside, pickled veggies are on point, and it's priced very well at around 4 dollars. Their egg rolls are also pretty damn good and only about a buck each. BEST BANH MI IN TOWN!

NuKXbHGptv0zTiIQe3nRpw.text: Delicious Pho, we came here based off the reviews. Everything was very fresh , even the coconut drink we had was as well.

UKmCIoR75xVhfLFOpJY9qQ.text: Really nice broth and the basil is sooooooo nice:) Highly recommended!  I would recommend their make your own combo! Also for those spicy lover, they have their spicy souse is really nice too:)

photos.caption: Photo of Pho Thanh Huong - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Thanks

qR3qyoeSnLDgymDWjVX4fw.text: We came here to have an early dinner before we headed for our flight back to Oakland.    This place is authentic.  I had the pho with tendon, without the noodles, and it was terrific! Lots of veggies, and the quality was fresh.  The soup base was superb.  Such a soulful meal, as it always hit home.    Yes, I would recommend.

l_AIWWl3e7XQ5TNSVD_QWQ.text: Came here to get some Vietnamese craving out of the way and I decided to try their bun bo hue. The broth was sweet little spicy flavorful. I liked the pork feet that was included in it. The bowl was $11.50 which is a little higher than other places in town. The noodles were nice and big just how bun bo hue should be. I think the broth was nice but it could use more bun bo hue flavor. I liked the veggies that came with it. The restaurant looks a little outdated and dull but they leave all the good condiments out on the tables for your convenient. I like how they had sate ready for your pho if you order it. I would like to try their pho here next time and banh mi.

photos.caption: Photo of Pho Thanh Huong - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pretty good bun bo hue

RVBq1P_xnUtaPe9CUeQl2w.text: I know, I know, what am I doing in Las Vegas that I find myself eating Banh Mi. Well a certain restaurant, not too far from here, had a wait of about two hours. So we wanted asian food and well, A. and I both agreed on some Vietnamese food.  A funny thing I've been told is when you walk into an asian restaurant and you just take a quick assessment of the customers and if you find that they're majority asian, then it must be good right? LOL  Sure it was cold but I wasn't going to get pho. I wanted something crispy and by looking at the Banh Mis that were passing the tables I wanted to get one myself and honestly at only $5 how could we have gone wrong?  I had the bbq pork banh mi, while A. had another with some cold cuts and a kind of pate. We also ordered shrimp crackers, which were like shrimp chips back home but larger and came in their own wrapped plastic bag. The fried chicken came out really quickly and it was super tasty. We were both trying to figure out what kind of spices or what they do to prepare it. My guess was it was baked. Delicious none the less.  The wait to get our order taken took a bit, but they had a sign out looking for help. The hostess and the waitress were both young girls, looking like they went to school at UNLV right across the street.

wKTN68ba67AgU6kYozAB-g.text: Fantastic. Friendly delivery person. Ordered a bunch of different items from the menu. All top notch.

5-g7hsY7bxBIcG6Fm-2kNQ.text: Seriously? $14 for a seafood pho and I get 4 tiny shrimp and a crab claw with barely any meat in it. What a joke. We eat pho once a week and our usual place was closed today. Thought we'd try this place and this is what we get.   Never ever again. Hope this place goes out of business. They didn't even bother to put in any sauce in the bag. Mind you, this was on a Postmates order so I'm sure the tiny portion was done on purpose because they know we aren't going to walk back in and complain.   For reference my girlfriend got the same meal and hers was the same pathetic size. Definitely wasn't an oversight just on mine.

photos.caption: Photo of Pho Thanh Huong - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Seafood pho

3vC6fPaZDVeuasKriD7lXQ.text: Still very good and very friendly service. I love the variety of greens offered and the freshness of all the vegetables and herbs. The grilled pork with noodles or the pho, depending on your mood, are fantastic.

photos.caption: Photo of Pho Thanh Huong - Las Vegas, NV, United States

y4rlx7fLzBE6mw_QHz7GQA.text: The best banh mi sandwiches we have had. Big enough to leave you satisfied and priced appropriately. Definitely coming here again the next time we're in Vegas.

CjZ-oX29MY1PgMhFh5mCNg.text: Great, authentic Vietnamese food right by the strip! Food was clean and fresh, I got a vermicelli noodle bowl with pork and the pork was probably the best Vietnamese pork I've ever had. So tasty! Well priced for the location and they have a ton of options including Bahn Mi, rice dishes, and Boba. 100% recommend :)

FNK7uu4J1SVoH5raZQ2Ekw.text: Absolutely love this place! I always have the same thing, the bun dac biet. The egg rolls are nice and crispy, and they don't drip oil. The amount of pork is reasonable. Fresh greens, good noodles.

photos.caption: Photo of Pho Thanh Huong - Las Vegas, NV, United States

ZV2hbHKcKGYU64AwrSRpTg.text: Already paid but waited at least 10minutes just to get a to go box while in a rush to get to school. Had to ask for it twice and btw, never got it!!  I understand it's peak hour but it doesn't mean both the waitress only focusing on unserved customers and simply forget or IGNORE other customers!!  Would never have paid 15% for tips, the service was definitely not worth it!!!  (Don't get me wrong, their food is good, love all of it. Only stating the fact that the service this time sucks)

4YaZ0WNr52y3nqceJmr-9g.text: I consider myself to be a pho connoisseur and have a high standards of pho cuisine and i must say this place does pho right! Firstly the portions are very generous so if you're very hungry, one bowl of pho should suffice your hunger. Also, the possibility to be able to build your own bowl grants a plethora of different combinations. Lastly and the most important aspect of this restaurant is that the food is delicious! I recommend to anyone who wants good pho!

RMgTKjVgWk5W2D_5X_dxbA.text: Pho Thanh Huong offers hot and cold noodle soup, a variety of rice dish, Banh Mi sandwich, and a great selection of beverages like club soda, smoothies with boba, and fresh coconut. For my meal I chose #24 Com Ga Xao Xa Ot which is a Spicy Lemongrass Chicken ($9.50) serve with a side of white rice and salad. They serve the meal really fast, it took within 10 minutes. The chicken taste very spicy. I was hoping there would be a hint of lemongrass flavor, but all I can taste is how spicy the chicken is. So I end up pouring a small bowl of sweet fish sauce over the chicken just to tame the heat. The salad taste okay. It's mainly fresh lettuce, cucumber, and two slice tomatoes topped with pickled radish. Even though it's a simple salad, it did balance nicely with the meal.  In addition, I chose #53 Che Ba Mau ($3.95) which is a Tricolored Dessert in a cup filled with green jelly, sweetened azuki beans, mashed yellow mung beans in coconut cream and topped with shaved ice. The Che Ba Mau is somewhat similar to the popular Filipino Halo Halo. The only difference between the two shaved ice dessert is that with Che Ba Mau, you get three ingredients and coconut flavor. Whereas with Halo Halo, you get a lot more ingredients including ice cream and they use evaporated milk. Personally I prefer Che Ba Mau, it's a light and tasty dessert and I like that it's not too sweet.  The restaurant can accommodate up to 57 people. The lighting is dim, but there is a lot of open space, you can sit comfortably without having your chair bump into any person. I notice the background music is a mix of R&B and Pop, the song I hear playing is "Havana." The service is very friendly. They are attentive and asked if I need anything and if everything is okay. Overall I feel good about my order, but I think it would have been better if I had ordered a Banh Mi sandwich.

Photo of Pho Thanh Huong - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Che Ba Mau: Three Color Dessert
Photo of Pho Thanh Huong - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Green Jelly, Sweetened Azuki Beans, Mashed Yellow Mung Beans and Coconut Cream Topped With Shaved Ice

4MGtH1s3lsmImpofKGG_5g.text: Cheap and decent Vietnamese.   Mushroom pho was $8.50 and grilled pork banh mi was $4.25. Both decent and priced well.   The suong sao nuoc da grass jelly with coconut cream was $3.50 and delicious. Thai tea was $4 and missable.

_Vpa9iBsl6auhFKgYYJSYQ.text: It was a pleasant surprise. Noodles were perfect texture and broth was very tasty. My bun noodle was very well balanced (unlike other places where they have mostly lettuce to make the serving look bigger). Egg rolls were so-so, however.   We were very tempted to order their boba drinks after noticing a lot of people getting them. Next time!  If I were a local, I'd definitely become a regular joint for a quick fix!

qbPqBmQ2Dcanvh304WW8Wg.text: The BROTH IS AMAZING ! So flavorful! Everyone knows the broth is what determines the Pho!   Plenty of noodles to meat ratio is perfect! You'll leave here feeling full and ready for a nap!

b1sm_zKDvoR0wRmeMcL6tA.text: The food here is very price friendly and the service gentlemen is extremely funny and nice. I spoke Vietnamese to him and we had good laughs with simple jokes in our native language. To point, if you're hung over and are looking for a good pho place outside of the strip to avoid spending another fortune - this is one of the places to go. Good luck ;)

-_n3x-bvyODQqEuOvFRk_Q.text: Little hidden gem right next to UNLV. I really wanted to eat a sandwich before I went to UNLV to study and Yelp recommended this place! I would've never thought I would be able to find a Vietnamese restaurant on this side of town.   Right when I walked in there was a cart full of fresh baguettes!!! I was so happy I called in and order a bahn mi. The smell alone made me hungry. The bahn mi was around $5 and it was bugger than a 6" at Subway.   As much as I wanted to down this bad boy, you know you cannot eat bahn mi's in the car.  FYI! The crunch of the baguette will dirty your car in an instant. Find a place, sit down, and let the flakes fly everywhere!!   The meat was so good and the pickled cabbage was fresh.   The parking is a bit sketchy but once you go inside it's clean and get a great welcome from the staff. The restaurant is definitely family owned as everyone was so nice.   Check it out if you're near UNLV and is craving a Vietnamese sandwich!

0Bu8GCyYokjmv2m9hToO6A.text: If you're vegan, you have to stop by and enjoy some Pho Chay (or get it to go-I did). Make sure to specify you would like vegetarian broth. I added mushrooms to mine for $3, the portion they served me was enormous so definitely worth being added for that price. The broth smells delicious and taste great before adding condiments. I love spicy food so I added some chili paste & the jalapenos they serve with the soup.  The noodle texture is amazing! And they fill your soup veggies !!! I will for sure be returning because the staff is super helpful and kind and this pho is the best I've ever had!!!!

tLhJCwk7tSicPEkqaXOHNA.text: I ended up walking out of this restaurant without even trying it.  1) The entire place stinks of cigarette smoke. This is a restaurant!! Why does it smell so heavily of smoke?!  2) I watched as the server grabbed the handle of an ice scoop that was sitting in a bucket of ice (the HANDLE part was laying in the ice), and then scooped ice into a water glass, dropped the scoop back Into the back (handle hitting the ice as well), filled glass with water, and brought that glass over to me.   3) I looked up and saw the "C" grade from the health department, and decided it was time to walk out. If this restaurant is clearly contaminating items that handle food in FRONT of guests, I can only imagine what's happening behind the scenes.   The restaurant needs a good cleaning to get rid of the smoke smell, but above all else, employees need to go through the food handling safety class. So, SO disgusting!!

LxU3mgjkkxQEyQBbNiDmMA.text: The food is good but the sandwiches are heaven!  Tried the barbeque chicken with pate...5 stars out of 5. Had them add extra jalepenos and veges.  Tried the barbeque pork with pate...5 stars out of 5. Also had extra jalepenos and veges.   The owner knows us by sight since we order 6 sandwiches for lunch (even great when a day old!) and sometimes even eat one bahn mi after a full pho dinner!  We've taken friends there and they wish they had the same restaurant at Milpitas CA.   The price is a bit higher than in Seattle but the flavor makes it worth the extra.

H_QFs2OfsTLKeqpKTezMXw.text: Never going there again...I was glad I didn't just munch in cause I was so Hungry, cause I found a plastic wrap in my soup bowl and to top it off, it took so long to get to my food.  Guess I caught them on a bad day .

EGzefWddG5mxbpu_n9ngkA.text: I've eaten Pho in many places----some the best and some of the worse.  This place is nice and clean on the inside, a plus. But, a red light came on when I saw the size of the menu offered.  I usually stay away from places that offer everything under the sun-----but the drive to Vegas got me hungry for Pho.  So I ordered a Pho Tai Chin and it came out in a timely fashion.  And that is when it went down hill, the broth was rather bland and the veggies looked old and wilted with brown spots.  But, the worse part was the Chin part was not lean at all ----it was curtains of nasty connective tissue and fat, totally inedible!!!  There was very little of the lean Tai beef, so I was forced to pick through a heaping mess of connective tissue to find some edible Tai beef.  I know now that Pho is not their strong point here, but it is decieving when its part of the restaraunts name.

mBKg55Z5kiJ_iNpJ255VVg.text: Not much flavor.  Awful service.  The food did not taste that great, I'll be on the look out for another Vietnamese restaurant.

lMszeQVd-VMF82RK8HrBWA.text: Decent Vietnamese restaurant, family owned.  The bread for the sandwiches are especially complementary with the different flavored contents. It's crusty on the outside, chewy in the inside and really good with a spread of pate! Perfect for banh mi cravings.

6Y09i33I37nIBKCFrKcBvQ.text: The sandwiches here are unbeatable. I love the bbq pork one. It's a classical. However the service here is terrible. If you come across the lady that works there just make sure that she really does get your order right. I once ordered to go and she gave me the wrong sandwich though she asked me 3 times and I kept repeating myself. But I have seen her on many other occasions doing the same thing to other customers as well. The easiest would be to just write down the number you want on a piece of paper and handle it over to her. Otherwise she still will not get it! I have seen her also talking on the phone to a friend or family member while customers were waiting and she just did not care. On another occasion we ordered some sandwiches and wanted to eat it in. The counter person asked us to place the order with the waitress and the waitress referred us back to the counter. It went back and forth before I started to complain. We could not believe it. It was ridiculous. The sandwiches here are great, all other dishes are very mediocre but the service is the worst..

ZLg0Ktlgjgtd7OqfjdXO1A.text: Pretty good banh mi. Service was fine and sandwich was fresh and delivered pronto. I liked the little slice of heat on it but felt like the sauce could have been better.

b6WHxXxIEBSGFP6nnWIHDg.text: This place was GROSS. The meat was fatty, the broth was salty and the service was horrific. Blech.

z7bLc99qHT3vK9u_4Dy0_w.text: we were craving some pho after a big night and we stumbled upon this place. the prices are a bit high and the veggies don't seem that fresh. however, i am not gonna complain when i'm hungover and hungry. we also tried the egg rolls which were alright. i will probably make it back in next time i am in town.

0TS6pxCtjaqoKmfxko40Bw.text: The food here rocks! Its my hidden secret.This is the best Vietnamese in town, no doubt!

wkbNV563gNGrmAOK1kLOYw.text: Honestly one of the worst Pho's I've had food and service!  Compare to the Pho's I've had in Orange County this place is far below average. The broth was very bland and the noodles were over cooked I couldn't really pick up the noodles without breaking.  And the servers just had a plain poor attitude  Very disappointed

T2k7dkr0Iq9VP1O-Hcp3sQ.text: On the hunt to get to more of my bookmarks during my lunch hour, I decided to give Pho Thanh Huong another shot. I came here years ago before I was on Yelp and thought they were good, but only if I happened to be in the neighborhood while craving Vietnamese.. They had pretty good sandwiches, but I just didn't end up back here again until today.   I ordered a grilled beef banh mi and Thai tea with boba. The sandwiches looked a lot different than I remembered them. The French bread they use is enormous and much bigger than on my previous visit. The meat they used was a little different than I'm used to in banh mi. It was a little smokier than I like but very moist. It was a little on the messy side. They packed it to go in a way that was difficult to eat without dripping meat juice all over myself while I ate. The pickled veggies were hidden under the meat which made them a little soggier and less crunchy. I'll have to ask them to put the veggies on top next time so they stay fresh and don't drown in meat juice. The bread was really great. A little breadier than I'm used to, more like a bolillo shape than French bread but very flaky and light. The Thai tea with boba was good. A little on the sweeter side, but still good.   The price is right, so I'll definitely give them another chance if I find myself in the area again. I was perusing the menu and their pho and other hot menu items seemed to run on the more expensive side compared to other pho restaurants I frequent. I think this is a good place to grab a cheap sandwich on the go.

This place is a hole in the wall but their food choices are awesome!!!  Located 5 miles from the airport, no traffic, parking is not a problem either!!!! RkXlTGFdL48TuSLBbSrlQw.text: I was in Vegas for a trade show and I always like a good good bowl of Pho. Got on Yelp to seek one out and found this place, and a great find it was. Brought a colleague along who never had Pho before. First slurp  in, he is now a Pho foodie. Great broth and chicken was of good quality. Also had a Bahn Mi (pork) sandwich. Great as well. Service was also good and our waitress was helpful, nice and attentive. Will be back on my next trip to Vegas.

4qJ8FJoXqyTgYvtzVXPajg.text: This place is great any time I go. The PHO is very very good.

drEV8L3DPauTC0rY1O8KZg.text: The service is terrible / - do not go here ! We sat down and waited over 20 minutes / no one came to take our order. I had to go up to the servers to ask for our order to be taken - the server was not friendly and said they were busy. They were not really that busy snd people who came after us were being waited on . They finally took our order and it took another 30 min before my friends were served with soup . Then it took another 15 min before my order came up - which was rice  and.meat . The food was very cold - I could not eat it .  I asked for a box to go so that I can heat it up at home .  She said she would get the box but she never got it - she just ignored me and served other people while I was waiting at the cashiers . Finally I had to ask another server and waited another 10 min before she gave me my totally bad service and bad food !! Do not go !! If there was a 0 - I would've given that rating to them -

Nu9-x1xjmfBlKkdDZP3ceg.text: With all honesty. I am surprise about the ratings. We called this store in advance, one of workers picked up the phone and just suddenly hang up the phone; therefore, we just went straight to the store.  When we got to the store, there were tables open; a table with four seats to be exact. No one was in line; we (there was 3 of us) were the only one. We didn't get seated until after 15-20 minutes of waiting.   When we got seated, we knew what to order and we were ready, but one of the male waiter told us to wait. We waited for 20 minutes just for a different waiter to get our order! Some of the customers that came after us got their order first. I get that theyre busy but they should atleast try and accomadate or atleast reassure the customer.   The restaurant, in my opinion, lacks organization or control; everyone seemed to be all over the place.  As for the food, I thought it was delicious. Definitely worth coming back to. The place is clean. However, with the experience that we had, coming for the first time, we probably wont come back. Sorry no tip.

7dkeo1l3gQ5c0e1Hk4sTVw.text: We were about to leave the airport and a craving for pho & banh mi kicked in. Yelp users y'all did not disappoint. Thank you! We had perfectly crisp & well seasoned chicken wings and egg rolls. the waitress recommended BBQ chicken banh mi - It was heaven in my mouth! Mi xao mem with chicken instead of pork, it was delicious! The seafood pho was good, but it could have been better. Ended with boba drinks - it was great! Attentive waitress and quick food delivery. Overall this place was amazing! We'll definitely be stopping by again, when we're in town.

ZOXSx6dFf8I4ipzj3tn-Zg.text: The service was poor. I honestly didn't feel welcome because as soon as my friends and I walked in we weren't greeted and the waitress was very moody.   In general is "ok". The service is not good, but Good for a place for a hangover.

PirHX2oQ891ebWdsJaMnzA.text: My first time trying this food outside of Vegas strip. All the way from LA to Vegas for this food what can I say? I'm a picky person when that's comes to Vietnamese food why? Probably because I'm a Vietnamese person as well and know my food? Lol. Anyways the food was really good I will defiantly go back here next time I'm coming back to Vegas!

B7pGtxtY4WQQF6dY7Jc5hw.text: I've been here before and every time I go to a pho restaurant I get the pho dac biet. This is probably my fave pho restaurant here in Vegas, everything is so good and fresh!

Oprux618KZjcyD0-PUzdXA.text: IMO, one of the best pho I've had in Las Vegas. Maybe it tasted better because I wasn't too busy being pissed off at shitty service I usually get at the other more popular pho restaurants?  My last time here was a LONG time ago, and I've been waiting to be around the area to go again. Tonight, I noticed they redesigned their menus and made some other changes to the decor. It looks nicer than last time.  The boyfriend and I normally get #28 the Special Rice Combo which comes with rice (duh), grilled pork, grilled shrimp and 2 fried eggrolls. Has a small side of vegetables (pickled carrots and daikon radish on top of lettuce, and tomatoes and cucumbers). I'm in love with pork and theirs is scrumptious. But their grilled shrimp is pretty amazing also... one of the best shrimp I've ever had AND THEY DE-VEIN THE SHRIMP! All this for $9.50!! And they make the shrimp look pretty... If that matters to you...  We also got the spring rolls.. they could use a little more "umph" since there was only like one slice of meat in it but their peanut sauce is good.  I told my boyfriend I don't think I want to go to any other Vietnamese restaurant other than here from now on. He HATES pho (yeah i know, who hates pho?!) but he took a small bite of mine and liked it so that means something, right?  Also idk about during the normal lunch/dinner hours because we normally come here around 9:30pm but we've never had to wait to be seated and they have pretty good customer service. Not extraordinary service or anything but they check in often, take our orders in a timely manner, refill drinks, etc. which is way more than what you're going to get at places like Pho Kim Long or Pho So 1.

photos.caption: Photo of Pho Thanh Huong - Las Vegas, NV, United States. #28 Special Rice Combo. Grilled pork &amp; shrimp. SO GOOD!

07zE0fhq9Kq-P8dKBVMBBQ.text: We stopped last night for so Phot , the food was good but the customer service needs extra improvement we order 2 hot teas and 1 regular black coffee. We got part of our food first then later the second plates before we left we hot the 2 hot teas no sugar or honey or lemon. Finally before we got ready too pay they asked if I wanted the coffee, I said with my meal wouldn't been great not now were already leaving!!! She made a smart remark as she approached the cash register cancel the coffee they don't want it ! Are you serious, what kind of service is this !!! Will not be going back any time soon, there's other phot restaurants town !

6PnsV6pBS0vmly755QBPwg.text: So for a work lunch today we were craving Vietnamiese! Spring rolls and pho here me come...  Ambiance It is located in a somewhat sketchy shopping center next to Vons. The inside of this place is definitely lackluster, it feels like it's been there awhile without any updates. What we found to be hilarious was the Usher circa 2000 they were blasting in the background, the CD literally skipped away...  Somehow the employees didn't seem to notice. But hey, I mean, if the food is good..  Service The waitress was nice enough. She did forget our iced thai tea, when we brought it to her attention she apologized and ended up taking it off the bill which we appreciated  Food We started off with the shrimp spring rolls & peanut sauce. The sauce was nice and rich but the spring rolls were certainly boring. Wolf didn't even realize there was shrimp inside until half way into his second roll! It looked like they just put green leaf lettuce, some tasteless shrimp and rice noodles. Kitty always orders spring rolls and unfortunately, to her, these were far from the tastiest; Some more herbs/veggies would have been nice.  Kitty ordered the beef broth pho, you can order whatever meats you want in it. Unfortunately the pho was just okay, even with tons of basil and lime it wasn't very flavorful. She appreciated the amount of meat in it but without a fulfilling broth it was kinda flat.  Wolf had the bbq chicken which comes with a tiny side salad and white rice. The chicken was great! The marinade/sauce was divine, just enough tang and sweetness, (with those satisfying grill marks) ! The chicken was tender, juicy and oh so yummy. White rice was white rice of course and the salad had some vinegar but otherwise the veggies were tasteless.   *So the question is... Will HOWL&MEOW return?  Naw. Not this place. Although the chicken was great nothing else stood out and there are so many other Vietnamese places to check out in Vegas. Stay tuned!

0w-lfkgiYTHSDtpnzZeFSw.text: In A Nutshell:  -Pho Thanh Huong is strategically near the McCarran International Airport. -If you get sick & tired of the buffets, over-priced burgers & top-shelf restaurants in Vegas & you're on your way home stop by this Vietnamese restaurant. -It's on the way towards the airport & is pretty much right next to it. -That means you don't have to go the opposite direction where the majority of the mom & pop Asian restaurants are located. -I tried out their Bun Dac Biet, which comes in a very large bowl full of rice noodles, thinly cut BBQ pork, two big eggrolls + veggies. -It was super-good.  Overall, next time I will try their pho.

D9e57DlJRq0-mdMTwfX67g.text: Stopped in here on my way into the City of Sin, and tried the Roast Pork Bahn Mi Sandwich! Man was that thing delicious! It was fresh and flavorful, and priced right too at just over $5.00 with tax! The bread was amazing, nice and crunchy on the outside, soft and tasty on the inside! The veggies were fresh, and the meats were tasty and plentiful! Service was efficient although the sandwich took about 10 minutes or so to come out, it was well worth the wait! I'll definitely stop in again as the sandwich was delicious and the prices are right as well!

9-w4CyLQYYdSk-cuZOo7uA.text: They have remodeled! There is a new cook however the food is still great! For a Vietnamese restaurant the service is good! Great job ladies!

12NT52H41lRBv6Ne8JkrHw.text: It took us a while to get seated, and it took approximately 25-30 minutes for our two pho dishes to come out. I'm not sure why it took so long, but pho shouldn't take more than 10 minutes, since the broth is prepared beforehand.  We also did the Yelp check in for 10% off our order and our server forgot to put it on our bill. When my husband paid, he asked if our 10% was included and the young lady who was handling our bill said no. Instead of correcting it she just let it be. We don't care about paying at extra 10%, but it's the (lack of) principle behind the customer service that made us very disappointed.   Pho was good despite the wait, but it doesn't compare to pho that you can get in Southern California like in Westminster or Garden Grove.  Food - 4 stars Wait (to be seated and for food to arrive) - 1 star Service - 2-3 stars  Overall - 2 stars

ja4bQ-LTpZ4WgJARw4he3Q.text: it's just an okay pho spot and overpriced. i'm from san gabriel valley and we have lots of pho restaurants that serve large sized bowls for under $10. the broth here is okay but nothing super special stands out to me and my bf as the other reviews have mentioned. i guess i've had more authentic tasting pho in san gabriel valley and orange county haha.   the servers barely pay any attention to you. they seat you, get you your food and never come back again lol.

xDglr9yHisl1d-I9E_6JUg.text: SURPRISINGLY FREAKING AMAZING!! My friend and I just happened to be in the mood for pho and noticed this restaurant across from campus. We walked in and immediately were satisfied with the staff who were attentive and pretty funny.       We ordered the pho with chicken and with beef. Both came out in about 10 minutes. AND y'all this shit was so delicious I started dancing. The broth was a perfect temp and seasoned with love. The noodles were perfectly cooked too. I ate what I could and put the rest in a to go (which didn't make it through the night lol)  5/5

n8QNhAeBXCfa-AZfZr8zEw.text: So, everyone needs a bowl of pho at some point when you go to Vegas (it's the perfect hangover remedy!)- This is most definitely the place to come to!!!  We were actually here for a weekend volleyball tournament. We ended up coming here twice in 3 days! Everything we had was so good- pho tai, bun, banh mi, spring rolls, soda chanh... NOTHING disappointed!  The grilled pork banh mi were only $3.25 and delicious!!! They actually make their bread there on site, & it's as good as the best I've had in SoCal!!!  The pho broth was so, so good- not too salty or strong. The noodles were perfectly cooked & never got soggy! Service was great & the restaurant was clean. A short drive down from the Strip in a random strip mall across the street from the UNLV Campus~ well worth the short trek down from any of the big hotels!  Definitely make this your go-to Vegas stop for Pho!!!

eGAane0vB4diIyvuYohE8w.text: Let's be honest.  I'm not Vietnamese.  This place is totally authentic. In fact, very little English being spoken. That said, love the experience. The food was delicious. Copious volume of food provided. Really enjoyed it. Fun social eating. I'm going again soon. It's a long ride from the west side, but it's worth it.

P0UH4Yv6qlrzs-Tg_w973A.text: My wife and I came here for Pho and BBH after tiring of Buffet. The restaurant is not very crowded and I though it must be no good. But I was wrong.  Pho is the best in Las Vegas.  The soup is clear and the the broth is smell soooo good.  BBH is also very delicious as well. I definitely come here again if I have a chance to visit Las Vegas.

CTgbJ__oGzwZP2wD6Vdktg.text: OMG. The banh mj here is AMAZING, the pho is good, and the vermicelli is flavorful. What don't they do well?  I eat pho on a regular basis-- probably every 2 weeks because it is my comfort food. So, when my husband and I flew into Vegas after a 2 hour delay, feeling tired, drained, and cold, all I wanted was some comfort food! After Yelping and seeing how close this was to the LAS airport, we came in and ordered a pho, a grilled beef banh mi, and a vermicelli combo dish. We were both SOOO happy with our meals!  Initially, I felt like my pho was not hot enough. The soup seemed lukewarm, so I asked for a bowl of hot broth to dip my beef slices. Our waitress was kind enough to bring a small cup over and it was exactly what I needed. Can't wait to come back!

photos.caption: Photo of Pho Thanh Huong - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Banh mi grilled beef
Photo of Pho Thanh Huong - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Combo pho
Photo of Pho Thanh Huong - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Zoomed in shot of banh mi!

3POG-69Sj53PholLaaOyfQ.text: Reasonable price by Las Vegas standard since it is by the strip. We had Lotus root salad, Dice Beef rice and grill beef Bahn mi. It took a while for the food the come out and the second beef bahn mi took longer. Not sure why, I think they messed up the order. We ordered a lime soda drink and the waitress forgot to serve it so we had to have it taken out of our bill. It was a slow day and there were several staff members so I am not impressed with their service hence the 4 stars. The food is good. Except, The grill beef is a little too sweet.  The lotus salad was excellent and their bread is amazingly fresh since they baked it at the restaurant daily! definitely it redeemed for the sloppy service.

photos.caption: Photo of Pho Thanh Huong - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fresh baguette bread for Bahn mi bake daily!

lEMHmDWd8bLX4b_5azuFRA.text: Came in for a little pho to go after a long weekend of partying. It was fast and friendly and the broth was wonderful and full of flavor.  I got the regular Pho Thai, my usual hangover remedy. The beef was tender, the veggies and herbs were fresh and I loved it.

HQv2Pn244Kdqxxr_AgkIJw.text: It's in a super sketch looking parking lot, but make the journey!  Pho broth- was so tasty, balanced, and full of flavor. I literally just spooned the broth in my mouth for 2 minutes before I even added anything or ate a noodle.  BBQ Pork bahn mi- GET IT!!! GET 2. Im sure it tastes great as a late night snack. The meat was perfectly seasoned and cooked, was super tender. The bread was crunchy on the outside and soft on the inside. The only thing I would change is it had a little too much mayo. I had to scrap some of it out.  Was bummed that they didn't have any boba for the smoothies, but it's alright. I plan on returning next time I'm in Vegas. Hopefully they will have more so I can try one of their smoothies.

aZpI8bHyGyqTnxyWLbccJg.text: I am from out of town and am always looking for a great place to have Pho, but that's not always an easy task.  I trust in reviews and thought I'd try this place--and I am glad I did.  Good service and great food!  Now back on the road!

uriSJoX2xrYa_8reqYw_jA.text: Followed the reviews on Yelp, we had lunch here as an exotic explore. I had the BBQ dried Pho and it was well flavored; my BF had Beef soup Pho(pic. menu#8) We both loved it!! The Beef was so tender and tasted great. Ice coffee is another must-try. Fairly cheap price made this restaurant more friendly to us. We will definitely go back again to try out other menu.

R3MZx8KzSERq1pq7t_Oicw.text: I come here for the tofu sandwich. A cheap, delicious and quick meal @ 2.75. The service however is very strange and awkward.

j1RXXuDrP1UeEWZc2aVykQ.text: I was very satisfied with menu item number 1.  My Cambodian friends really liked some of the other items. Its a very traditional place and big break from the obnoxious other restaurants in Vegas. The bread and sandwiches are excellent and healthy!

YyyCWu8AEaaGg_ZsfFRADA.text: Been here twice, satisfied both times. I've had pho dozens of times, but never  Pho Tai Sate, which is pho tai with a spicy broth -- spicy deliciousness! Also the Vietnamese sandwiches or Banh mi were fresh and tasty. Banh mi usually cost around $2 and, like a Vietnamese version of the Po'boy, don't always have the freshest ingredients (at least in my experience). But the bread was toasted to perfection -- crispy on the outside and soft on the inside -- and everything inside was solid, too. My next trip I had the fresh spring rolls, which didn't disappoint, and a combo Bun (vermicelli noodles) with pork, shrimp, and egg roll. The pork was perfect, but the egg roll was so-so and the shrimp nothing to write home about. But oerall, a definite keeper.

YVhymBy7_FRlqKQ2WxaqTg.text: I was feeling sick from a night of binge drinking. My stomach was queezy and I needed pho ASAP.  This place usually gets 4 stars but I'm a pho eating machine from the bay area. Honestly, it's a 3. The seafood pho was ok; broth was ok, imitation crab was too soft, two prawns only, yellow noodle was ok. However it was enough to ease my stomach. The place was clean and the waiter was friendly. There were many out of towners and also UNLV students. Overall good experience. Price was decent. Don't expect too much.

e-jU6OdjP3fyHDcFaO_Zlw.text: Well worth a 3/4 mile walk down Tropicana this evening.  First, the negatives, because they are minor and few:  the decor is nothing to write home about--clashing colors and some dusty silk orchids in a neglected corner.  The server was a little hurried, but not unbearably so.  Now, the positives:  interesting selection, really great noodle soup, generous portions, good prices.  I had a mixed seafood (squid, shrimp, faux crab, fish balls) noodle soup and a mango pearl shake.  Everything was fresh-tasting and appealing.   I'll definitely return to try the sandwiches another time.  I've returned once, no change in rating.   I had a bowl with shrimp cakes, pork, vegetables and noodles.  I also had a taro pearl shake.  Everything was tasty.  Taro pearl shakes are mild and a little sweet (just enough), and a strange color lavender.  I like lavender-colored food because it just looks WRONG, and I find "wrong" appeals to my anarchic side.

sDEfd8g5DyNQZfzH0sIvLA.text: I liked the grilled pork bahn mi. It had just enough filling for me not to complain and at $2.75, it's a pretty damn good deal. That seems to be the going rate across the country if you've had these before. The outside crust of the bread could have been crispier other than that it was great. Do yourself a favor and don't order the crepe. Nuf said regarding that.

lHI8gbjUKe-hBBiR1ECeUg.text: Soild Pho and Vermecelli. Dont expect much in terms of service you are lucky if they take your order within 10 minutes of sitting down but the food speaks for itself and I enjoy this place for lunch when in Las Vegas.

7NAKI3Kp7Q0_oJxCV6hBWw.text: We walked from the Hard Rock hotel there.  Not the brightest idea given the desert heat.    The food itself was well presented and had quite a few variety of traditional dishes to choose from.  We were however very disappointed with the service.  Our waiter missed our spring roll order and didn't speak english very well to understand what we wanted.  Your best bet is pointing to a picture on the menu....  Overall you can't beat this place in the middle of a desert if you're craving ghetto style pho

eWAgIJXfAM8fuvIzARd4qQ.text: alright i know that vietnamese service usually sucks... but... they really sucked. they wrote down the wrong order and forgot our drink orders... it was so hard to get their attention too!  the food was relatively good... but for las vegas standards. i'm from san jose so it's kind of biased to compare.  i would go back again, just order togo or something!

kWQTxH48mo9WmfXQPusVuw.text: Not the most attractive shopping center location or friendliest service, but the food here is ligit, not like Panda Express or the other semi-food "asian theme" places.  The meat wasn't like the sizzling barbecue of the Pho Bac Ky in Irvine, but the egg rolls were crisp and noodles plentiful.  I would definitely come back here for my next hankering of affordable Vietnamese.

BmDRwZJ-nv7drxKsPMMAIA.text: Totally agree with the rest of rev-s. Atmosphere is probably not the best (in terms of ambiance) but food is a great and worth the money spent. I often get their $3 sandwiches when I go skiing or hiking.

AnffRXeKGXYDrWid9ty3tQ.text: Pho Thanh Huong has became my favorite Vietnamese restaurant for pho and sandwiches. Also, the prices are decent and the food is tasty. I can't imagine going anywhere else to get my Vietnamese food fix.

ceWi3DI8Ze_aV3ZoTcPshQ.text: Really great food here, especially the banh mi. My friend, a pho connoisseur, deemed the pho better than Pho Kim Long. Only thing that keeps it from 5 stars in my book is that service is sketchy. That comes with the territory for Vietnamese restaurants but one time I sat by myself for 10 minutes and didn't get -any- service (i.e., no one came to the table to help me). This last time was good and prompt, though.

XhSkPbTjbsHADq4heL4Zrw.text: The first time I came here it was the perfect cure for the morning hangover and portions were perfect. Recently, I returned hoping for the same great experience and it was extremely disappointing. I didn't try the sandwiches but the pho was less than satisfying. I got the combo special and felt like the portions were literally cut in half and I didn't see any tripe. I was lucky enough to get half a meatball! I would come back but next time I'm gonna pay 7 bucks for the large bowl. Shrimp rolls were bomb though.

pLUrpdavMziDYS84tWrq5g.text: I only come here when I am in the mood for banh mi, so I can't comment on anything else on the menu (but I've heard that the pho isn't that great).  The sandwiches are cheap and they taste fresh.  I have always taken my orders to go, so the cleanliness--or supposed lack thereof--hasn't bothered me.  This certainly isn't a place to go out for a weekend dinner, but it makes for a great lunch every once in a while.

t_RkU_5LhULNuxbKMtzJWw.text: I didn't try the pho here, but their bahn mi is awesome. I'm originally from Seattle and I'm so happy to have found a place that sells Vietnamese sandwiches. Of course in Seattle you can still find them for a buck a piece, but I suppose beggers can't be choosers out here in the desert. My only complaints were that the restaurant smelled a little dingy and the young guy who helped me was kind of a jerk. Other than that I'd definitely go back for those sandwiches!

S3uUx1Eto3rqzGW7yDdTaQ.text: Not bad for a restaurant outside of Chinatown. The pho, bun bo hue and banh mi are fairly good and reasonable priced. The appetizers and drinks aren't too bad either. The restaurant is clean and the decor is plain. The service isn't so good. I had to get the waiter's attention a few times. Overall not too bad.

uvfVwNz02lSA7rMGNLAj-w.text: BLECH-itude.  From the second we pulled into the older strip mall where this resto is located, I had a feeling I wasn't going to like it. The feeling continued when I walked in and got the distinct smell of recent cigarette smoking (perhaps from within the kitchen?) No matter, I thought to myself - the banh mi will be worth it.  I was (sniff sniff) wrong.  Though the bread was warm, it didn't have the flakiness that I've come to enjoy with good banh mi, and the filling to bread ratio was sadly lacking.  The daikon/carrot mix inside the 'wich overpowered all of its other flavors... so much so that I kept adding chili sambal paste to make this meal go down easier.  Even my banh mi companion (she believes herself to be an expert) admitted that the food was below sub-par. Add to that the overall inattentiveness of the staff, and well... SIGH. Too bad.  I really wanted to like this place after reading some of the rave reviews but, after my experience, don't think I'll be returning.  Only highlight: the low prices -- $3 for a 'wich ain't bad.... but the old adage, "You get what you pay for...." seems to ring True here.

DCabevp5v1inveOdErgUIA.text: we ALWAYS eat at this place whenever we go to vegas.  nevermind that i live in the southbay where pho restaurants are on every corner.  this place is good, even coming from a vietnamese person who eats this stuff all the time.  try the chicken pho...its my

HVkamxqZH8OBkWyOjjetrg.text: Three words...Wtf! I paid 8 dollars for some broth w barely any noodles in it! You know what I can buy w 8 dollars??? Two lipsticks! 8 dollars should mean a big bowl of food. And I got a Ham sandwich and it was nast-ay. Go too Lee's sandwich instead for reals

5TauYOqKumHBpceSnHhJdw.text: I can't believe I'm giving a five star. I am VERY picky, especially when it comes to Pho. The Pho here is phenomenal. Oddly enough, the best Pho I have ever had was in Oklahoma CIty!?!?!?!?! This place easily stacks up with the best of them there. Been living in Las Vegas for 9 months now and just today got around to  trying this place. Best move I've made since the move to Vegas. Great food, friendly staff and large portions!!!!

kq2qz2iqUvN9jQcX5eZHZA.text: Went here on our 4th of July trip.  The food was good but not as good as back home (So Cal) ;-)  Wife had the BBQ Pork & Pate Banh Mi and I had the Grilled Chicken Banh Mi.  The sandwiches were pretty good, the meat were nicely flavored but it didn't have the crunchy outside.  The Spring Rolls were a flop because there was too much rice wrap and it was tough.  They were so springy on the outside that it reminded my five of those gel filled rubber stress tube things (and they were the most expensive things ordered).  To drink we had the an iced coffee and a thai iced tea.   They were both pretty good, but they put too much milk and made the drink kinda thick.  Will definitely come back when we need out vietnamese fix in Vegas and also to try some of the pho.

X7q0DvO8qQQFKrapMks-Rw.text: Some of the best pho I've eaten! Naturally, this was the best cure to quite a long night out on the strip. The broth was super onion-y, which made it really flavorful. Only downside is that it was a bit more pricey than normal.. $9 for a bowl of pho? Doesn't make much sense, but the service and food were great. Nice little find out in Vegas.

Z0HhqCOdihRqxDQhjWFuUA.text: place is located off the strip of vegas and is pretty chill to hit up on the way home if youre driving... their pho broth is pretty flavorful and their porkchop aint too bad... the guy waiter kept misunderstanding our order for some reason... had to re-repeat our order like 5 times...  FINALLY... their banh mi is bomb... the bread is soft, the pepper they put inside gives it a spicy kick and is one of the best banh mi i have had... so definitely come here for the banh mi and you wont be disappointed...

leudUXJlk7vjWYu8VxXrnA.text: I visit Las Vegas at least once a year and Thanh Huong is the first place I think of when losing that big bet on the blackjack table. The food is extremely cheap and delicious. The staffs are very friendly and the service is unbeatable. However; the food takes quite a while to arrive to the table, but that's always a good sign for me because I know that my favorite dishes are being cooked instead of microwave.  Dont let the name fool you. They may be called Pho Thanh Huong, but they sell a lot more then just Pho. They have from Vietnamese/French style sandwiches to many authentic dishes. Water and tea are free, but I highly recommend the milk coffee with bubba tea.

ym-C94swXsHv0PKXBXB1gA.text: They offer generic condiments, not the real stuff: the hoisin sauce is liquidy and not thick. They don't have Sriracha--you cannot have pho with generic sriracha hot sauce. Friend found egg shells in his pho soup. Horrible tea (tra da). Overpriced.

vwKdgc3m3YBEr09xhjPGig.text: Best Banh Mi I've had yet in Vegas. Even better when you get a decent sized sandwich for under $3. Place is a hole in the wall in a strip mall, but the sandwiches are great. Haven't tried the pho yet.

GgqM3Itl3OPMhYEz17VDgA.text: service is a bit slow but the grilled pork banh mi is the best i've ever had.  i always come here at least once every trip to vegas. their eggrolls rock too! oh and of course, pho is delish!  also a good place cuz vons is right next door and you can pick up some water and beer to take back to the hotel!

LK0lHFO9Q-V7gYZ9HawFEw.text: We just happened to notice the place on a walk while in town and decided to go here for lunch.  Absolutely delicious!  Can't beat the prices, quality, service, and cleanliness!  We shared a shrimp salad from the appetizer menu and each had a sandwich.  We'll be back!

YKegNJRCq_QV_t5KCovi2w.text: Soooo slow jeeze louise! The first time I came here, I wasn't too impressed with their Bahn Mi. I came back a second time and ordered a fried egg and Chinese sausage Bahn Mi. Definite improvement, but still didn't make up for waiting 20 minutes for a sandwich. Meh. I've experience better.

qRfNWQARspIFLzV07_63HQ.text: I ordered the tofu noodle salad and it was delicious. The atmosphere was clean and the cashier was very helpful in helping me decide what to order. I will be going back!

ep8iO1Kufgn2sVXxJA7cqA.text: Best Bahn Mi in town!  The bread is always perfect, and the fillings are fresh.  Generous portions at a great price.  Love the mom and son team.

INVOlPt1zcpDj5494koR6g.text: Not as good as it used to be - the Pho is really bland now, they were skimpy on our bean sprouts (1 wimpy plate of all the toppings for 2 bowls of Pho!) and service is not great. Also, they have a new menu that is way smaller and doesn't have pictures. The old one was cheezy, but i kinda liked it.  :)

Z9KwXNJme5DmSLhpJajiHQ.text: I ordered  three BBQ pork sandwiches. For $3 a sandwich (including tax!!!!), you can not go wrong with this deal. The quality for the price is definitely one of the best deals in town.

2OGwlsDrUBBz-XSS1xG6aA.text: It took us a while to find this place but man was it worth it when we found it.  Their broken rice was spectacular.  I had the broken rice with pork steak, Vietnamese sausage, and tofu wrap shrimp cake.  The sausage was average but everything else was delicious; the pork steak and tofu wrap shrimp cake were the best I've had at any Vietnamese restaurant.  I'll be back next time...and bringing even more friends.  Check this place out when you're free, it's better than a lot of the crap they call food on the strip.  It's cheap price and yet delectable at the same time.

rSWpe1_8xUIO_MxmFR88UQ.text: I love you, Pho Thanh Huong.  I can't pronounce your name, so I call you "That sandwich place at school."  The prices are perfect, the sandwiches are incredible (My criterion for good food is that I lay up at night in bed sometimes and want it.  This has happened a few times already.)  The decor is really much better than it was, and there is AC now, with a few portable (and quiet) units.  The service is quick when you do sit-down, and they're nice enough people, but of course they're not 5-star-restaurant material.  Highly recommended, get #1, it's the most flavorful.  The best thing to do when going with someone is to share a pho (which ever one you like) and a sandwich each.  That way you avoid over-ordering.  This will probably run you about $12.    A great local place, so good, and so cheap, you could eat here every day!  (Or I could.)  (if I wasn't a broke college student).

JIYKUG3rEK9MIYr4k58zuw.text: Best Pho and Viet sandwiches in Vegas! Reminds me of all the delicious places in the Bay Area. The soup has a solid flavorful broth, and they don't skimp on the meat or noodles. The sandwiches are large and filling.

EZi21rT0CFixXJ8Iov9GdA.text: Pretty decent place, the area is clean and the service was pretty good too. I ordered the Pho Ga, and the noodles were very thin and that's the way I like it. :) I think the pho was kind of bland and needed a tiny bit more flavor. But that's okay, I guess. I believe it was about 9$ for a bowl of pho, which is pretty expensive.

3lkQt2o2tnAIJ4SMCBvPxA.text: Did not have the sandwiches. However, my party ordered a few Phos and some rice plates. All came out well. The grilled pork and baked eggs were especially tasty.

jl1i8y01absroG-cvbX3mA.text: I was not feeling well and really wanted some good soup. I got off work and was able to call in an order and pick it up on my way back to my hotel. The portions were great and the broth was not over salted. The customer service was great. I would go there again if I'm ever back to Vegas.

5bxZghBrT7Fx2WmfYYR_Gw.text: My group of 15 family members arrived in Vegas for our family reunion, very ready to eat. We decided to try this place because it's a combination of my mom and dad's names (what a coincidence/silly, I know).   We walk in and are hit with what I think was the smell of acetone floating in through the vents connected to the nail salon next door. Gross.   We were seated quickly and service was decent. Fortunately, the food started rolling out pretty soon (must have had pho on deck) and we could not longer smell the acetone.   I ordered the lemongrass chicken with rice. It was pretty good (tender chicken, fluffy rice), although the sauce was a little too intense for me. I tried some of my brother's pho, and I was not super impressed by the broth. Not sure I'd ever go back, but if I do, I'll probably try a different rice plate.

photos.caption: Photo of Pho Thanh Huong - Las Vegas, NV, United States

VIdVHC1bntWVUlP2v1oEZQ.text: This place is so good. Their bahn sandwich is so freshly baked definitely come back to this spot again.

A82S1rpT3XMJlKbOKBN50w.text: 1- star. The service was bad. We never had any refill (the 2 servers were eating right in front of us). Order fried rice and server did not put it in. Waited for 20mn after we finished all the food. Finally we had to ask and told the waiter he missed our order. Had to waiit for another 20mn.  2.5-stars. Food was ok but out of touch. Advertised 5 shrimp crackers (2.5 dollar very expensive) but only brought out 3. Waiter said it was old price.  1-star. Never seen such a thinly cut beef. You can see light through it. Charged for 8.50. Only 3 pieces of lemon were given. We used lemon to neutralize bacteria (it is an old belief) or brown the raw beef (cook in acidic lime). Usually 6 to 8 was given. The crushed peanut was undercooked (fried).  1-star. No pickled carrot was given for the eggroll. Never seen such tiny shrimps in fried rice in a Vegas restaurant before (see photo).  We won't come back

photos.caption: Photo of Pho Thanh Huong - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Raw Beef with lime (lime to be squeezed onto the raw beef  before eating)
Photo of Pho Thanh Huong - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Tiny and expensive crackers, 80c per chip Been out too long no shrimp flavor.
Photo of Pho Thanh Huong - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Tiny shrimps

cPaLTm4IvkZm2q0fpr3czw.text: This is my favorite go to pho restaurant! They never fail me everytime! Very good service, very cozy place and very good food! Their grilled beef ribs just melts in your mouth, and their Pho are the best! I would recommend this to all my friends!

Zl0hK5nNJEfvHzU1SWMNYQ.text: Horrible service.  We ended up leaving because we waited 10 minutes for the server to come to our table to take a drink order.  There was one server in the entire restaurant.   I tried this Pho restaurant because it had 4 star reviews in Yelp and I'm so disappointed that I wasted my time.

NRInzbrnJXXobcpWf7VkbQ.text: Near UNLV  and the strip this place is local spot !!! Great food their Pork banh mi is super delicious their bread is fresh!!! My favorite

bPnmiCoabuwNlDOg9hJsRQ.text: This place's service is so bad.  We waited more than 30 minutes for the pho until we decided to leave, and it's not even rush hour.  There were only 4 tables there.  It was our first time,  but for sure there won't be another.

Q0FV_0uOsIlDK69DxBEqbg.text: this place has amazing food. the prices are a little more but you pay for the quality. the eggrolls and pho there are amazing. sometimes the wait is a little long but your food comes out quick.

HgHJkFJ-HbSu5Zxwaiwyww.text: New to Vegas, of course I had to try out the pho. I had the mien tom which they were nice enough to make since its not really in their menu which I appreciated. All was very yummy although I do wish they'd have a vegetarian broth. Overall I was a happy camper and they were very generous with their toppings !

-jAzFg8gbvnpymKABQXEAw.text: 3.5 stars, but I'll round up to 4 based on the sheer value near the strip. From the outside, this strip mall seems best to be avoided, but if you're looking for cheap eats, stop by for sure. When ordering their sandwiches, don't get fancy. Stick with the BBQ pork. The others are just okay. They also don't load them up with as many pickled veggies as other pho joints so it lacks some depth. Get a bowl of their 'built it yourself' pho and you get to pick exactly what goes in to it. I told them everything, and indeed I got all the 'adventurous' bits  :)  I'm happy I found this place. They usually have some UNLV student working here, so service is decent.

photos.caption: Photo of Pho Thanh Huong - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Grilled pork sandwich is good and most popular. The fried egg with sausage is nice too.

5js7Fav0awRgL26cKFAO9w.text: Long story short, we (party of 4) flew into Vegas and picked up our rental car to drive out to Utah and Arizona for our 6 day national parks/scenic trip. We stopped in here to grab a quick bite before starting our trip and it was the best/worst idea ever. Best because the food was great but worst because throughout our entire trip we were comparing everything we ate to the food here and wishing we had taken some sandwiches to go (which we didn't ugh!). On our way home, we drove like a maniac from the Grand Canyon and made it back to Vegas in good time, just in time for some departure Pho. (They open at 10am! I've never had Pho at 10am!) We were all afraid the quality would've changed but it hasn't. The pho was still delicious and the Viet sandwich with ham and cold cuts was still delicious. If I'm ever in Vegas again, this would be my first and last stop.

xc_5PCX7K1Oq6tSHDDMYbA.text: Delicious Vietnamese food! I had the pho ga and it was one of the best I've ever had. My dinner was served very quickly, within just two or three minutes.

Sirg6d6pnPOLzw5gVh7XEA.text: This place has good pho and very good and inexpensive sandwiches. Their seafood pho is a little pricey compared to other pho places. I think it's expensive because they put an actual crab (one piece) rather than artificial crab (which is multiple at other places) but it's good. If you check in and mention yelp you get one free yelp review. The sandwich is perfect size with good portion inside and very inexpensive. It's nearby UNLV so I'll be coming back whenever I'm on campus or nearby :)

mdpm7lqXAV7SBLcYx4yLVA.text: That time you go to a pho restaurant with a craving, and leave wanting pho.   Yelp really let me down here. No way this place is 4/5.  Also, the Yelp check in coupon isn't accepted anymore.  There was a strange smell permeating throughout the empty restaurant.   I got the Pho Dac Biet, best way to judge a pho restaurant. Broth had a mild flavor, there was one or two pieces of each type of meat, and there was a moderate amount of noodles to mask the lack of substance to the bowl.  Thoroughly unsatisfying.   We also got a sandwich, which was made with yesterday's bread. I know when you do sandwiches to go, they're not super warm.  However, our sandwich came out cold. Danggggggggg, that's saying to me "we're not even trying."  The sandwich itself was alright  once it warmed up in my mouth.   The prices were okay, but there's too many nearby restaurants that actual try and are more deserving of your patronage.

XPzdZdIq9M1LUxULU0MGmg.text: Great broth on pho, shrimp rolls are good but sauce was bland. I also ordered the egg rolls but when I took a bite I found a white string inside and lost my appetite. This place used to be my favorite, the owners are wonderful and nice. I remember when they first opened I come often and service was outstanding.

photos.caption: Photo of Pho Thanh Huong - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Egg rolls and fish balls! Yummy!

4npt-YKyeNWZTBAnucQTcg.text: We have been coming here for the past two years and order #11 Pho with everything and their egg Bhan Mi sandwich regularly, and with no fail they  taste consistently good. Their diced beef rice dish is also a good recommendation  Whether we come here as a party of 16 and half of it are under the age of 9 or just 4 people their service is always good and are accommodating to our littles. They maintain their cleanliness specially their restroom. We would definitely keep coming back here.

BcqEAn4y5doAkytp4yt5QQ.text: Thus far, best Pho in Vegas! Not too far from the Strip, inexpensive, close to the airport,  decent service.  Being local, the fam and I frequent this place when we are in the mood for Pho or Bahn Mi sandwiches. Always on point. Their egg rolls are amazing too! Been to several others around town and the broth here is such a level above the others. Sooo good!  Hope that you give this place a shot. It is well worth it!

r0HpxSDcQy9y8jDfkAq0ug.text: I never waited for an order of pho for so long. Was picking up Togo and ordered a pho Dac biet and young coconut. Waited for 30 mins to get my coconut and 40 mins for my pho. Which was only given to me when I asked for a refund...so disappointed. Made me late for an event that I had at 7 and was thinking to grab a quick bite before it. Don't come here if you want fast pho. Usually within 40 mins I would've been seated ordered and finished eating by the time I got my pho today. Will not recommend this place

56gw2Wy0ItS4IJ8lbS8rFA.text: Legit!  Found a gem this time in vegas cause we didn't have any food credit. ahahaa  Pho - Good, but I feel it had a bit too much MSG.  Was feeling the thirst afterwards. Banh mi (Thit Nuong) - Very good.  So good, we came back the second night for more! Bun Thit nuong - We got this to go and I was pleasantly surprised at how good this was.  The bun was very fresh.  If you dine in, the atmosphere feels "dull" for some reason.  I would still come back.

GcgIj6C4e_72D_KY2zqcTw.text: Like I said, I knew I would be back to try their Banh Mi (Vietnamese sandwiches) on my next flight out.  The BF and I grabbed three sandwiches to share and what a great deal it was.  They have their own ovens back there to bake their own French bread, which makes these sandwiches even more ideal!  We got the recommended #1 Grilled Pork (Banh mi Thit Nuong) with pate added as well as the #13 Grilled Chicken with Pate (Banh mi Pate Ga).  Both sandwiches were so good, great flavor and a nice heat from the jalapenos.    What a steal for three sandwiches for $10!  Definitely the place to go to grab some banh mi for the road!  Update! (09/02/10)  Stick to the sandwiches and maybe the pho - don't try the Hainan chicken rice dish.  It was VERY dry, probably among the worst I've had!  It was old and definitely not something theyspecialize in!

-bYoMDWjO9WfYHybYRCFMg.text: This restaurant has the best tofu spring rolls I have ever tasted. Whether with the peanut sauce or the sweet and sour sauce, they are incredibly delicious and definitely worth a try!

7e3VYqv3gHqYJZFDrq1Tlg.text: Been to many pho and viet restaurants in my life time, and PTH has customer service and food on better sides than most. Reasonable price, good & clean food (they can tightly wrap salad roll like nobody's business) - my fav is vegi pho & pho ga/chicken - and attentive college kids at work. My reg stops for pho. I love mixing sate into the soup. Just wish they'd add Chinese donuts to the menu in the future. Nothing cures hangover like pho.

xZg_5WZ8OMdKhtAVTyxgUg.text: I ordered a #1 Grilled Pork based on reviews here and the milky eye guy said it was most popular.  It measures 7" compared with 9"+ elsewhere. They are pretty light on vegetables and do not use cucumbers.  The pork was decent, maybe next time I'll have them add pate.  I took the advice of another Yelper and did a little shopping at Vons while they made the sandwich so I don't know how long it took to prepare.  I like the banh mi at Hue Thai better although more expensive.

photos.caption: Photo of Pho Thanh Huong - Las Vegas, NV, United States. #1 Grilled Pork Banh Mi

30cbD2nA9sSCWoQPguZZwg.text: I ate here as I am wanting to have the top 10 sandwiches as decided by Las Vegas Weekly.  So, I had the banh mi thit cha.  The bread was super fresh and crusty.  The ingredients were all very fresh, but I found myself wanting more vegetables, which is something given that I am a huge carnivore.  They add an awesome crunch.  The sandwich was very good, and as most note, a great deal at less than $4.  I also had egg rolls, which were standard.  I will say they brought my sandwich out at least 7 minutes before the egg rolls.  I understand they take longer to cook, but I would have preferred everything being brought out at once.   I will likely return, the staff was friendly and it was a comfortable place.

oastT7L1KLbwk3lMXvoILw.text: Yum!!!!! This place is delicious. I could eat here every day. The staff is very friendly and brings out your food at very reasonable times.

TVUB3KRumGHXKHtbUkGtZQ.text: Awesome food. Fast service! Got the grilled pork sandwich only $3.25! The pork egg rolls are way bigger than other vietnamese restaurants and taste just as great. Will return again!

lOKqCNb5cEG49e6fQNr3fA.text: This is one of my favorite spots to grab a bite to eat. I love that they are very accommodating to my vegan diet. They were willing to substitute grilled tofu instead of pork for the vermicelli noodles as well as a yummy banh mi sandwich. I also loved that they actually flavored my tofu with taste like a garlic, sesame, soy sauce. My husband loves the huge bowl of pho in coconut milk and spices. I order the side dish of noodles and side dish of soup for my kids to share (it is huge). Only think my kids were not too fond of was the meatballs. Very tough texture and not appetizing to my husband and kids. All-in-all this is a favorite spot.

Eq-aB8d22oTJg73ZHoltzA.text: Good food for the price. The restaurant is can accommodate large groups. They are quick with orders and all the staff is friendly and helpful. They offer take out and are quick about getting orders ready. A nice place for an affordable and delicious lunch in comparison to the other fast food junk around.

14nrClApZI7aJw9QldjiRw.text: Located near Vons on Tropicana and Maryland (across the street from UNLV), Pho Thanh Huong has the BEST tasting Vietnamese Coffee with Tapioca Boba I've ever had!  Their tapioca boba is almost always flawlessly cooked - the perfect blend of chewy and soft.    When you enter the restaurant, there is an area where "to-go" food/drinks (eggs rolls, shrimp chips, etc) may be ordered.  Past the "to-go" area is restaurant seating.     Food Selection: Pho Thanh Huong offers inexpensive menu items similar to what you would expect from a typical Vietnamese pho restaurant - beef noodle soups, rice plates, sandwiches, egg rolls, etc.  We ordered Pho Tai (beef noodle soup with rare steak) and Com Tam (broken rice with BBQ pork) with a side order of fried eggs.  The food is average tasting but tasty enough to satisfy my Vietnamese food cravings.   Customer Service: The employees are pleasant and will accommodate any special requests without judgment.  My food orders have always been fulfilled in a timely manner.  This restaurant appears to be family-owned and I love supporting small businesses.    Miscellaneous: The restaurant's decor is to some extent outdated but their restroom is clean and there is plenty of parking.   Will I Return? I will definitely return especially for their very addicting Vietnamese coffee!

MaoJ_-MLGu9EuMg6EQApaA.text: This place is absolutely amazing! My bf and I have gone super far to find a good Pho place finally we went to Pho Thanh Huong and man it is by far the best Pho place in town. Their spring rolls are also to die for. Prices are very fair and service is awesome. Definitely my new Pho place!

jojkhlpYCWH23Ym1qyoLhA.text: Came across this place by accident. Glad we stopped in. After a long day of shopping this really hit the spot.Tried this place pretty good. I would come back when I'm visiting Vegas. The spring rolls not so good

photos.caption: Photo of Pho Thanh Huong - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Beef broth and rare steak

KilSlk55UOvcPIIGp3ZthA.text: The service was a bit slow. There were quite a few people eating when myself and my friend arrived and it took a very long time for someone to finally come take our order. The drinks we ordered were iced coffee and were not brought right away but about 5 minutes after ordering. The coffee was very good and very strong, perfect for Vegas hangover. I ordered a pork sandwich and it was so good. The meat was great and the bread was so light and fresh. I could tell they bake the bread on-site everyday. I really enjoyed the food here and would eat there again. The pho looked really good too from what I could see around me.

Uqx2hRBpzJy5KgCxqHD1Vw.text: Tried their chicken pho & a sandwich the server recommended and everything was delicious. I was pretty hungover and it brought me back to life. The customer service was good too and it's at a pretty good location.

NjSXPV0Flw9w5O5fc0mQ-A.text: I got the #11 pho with any desired topping to choose. The beef broth was good! The bowl was large and worth the $8.50! BUT I found 2 strands of hair in it!!!! And another 1 in my mouth.... I didn't want to tell the worker but I should've. The servers were nice and the food was good, so I felt bad if I complained to them.

L6GLOUuuh5m5hYDDwVzLjQ.text: I heard their sandwich is the best in town, I stopped by and tried it once, for each sandwich it's only $3.5 including tax and the quality is really really good. I also tried the Pho, the broth was clean and tasty. The service was really accommodating. The place looks warm in general. Wouldn't be the best restaurant to take your date but would be the best restaurant to stop by to eat with ur friends and family.

MEzwDvy-QxgMnrtT2jv0UQ.text: Food: 4 stars Service: 3 stars Price: 5 stars  This vietnamese noodle shop is located in a not-so-good looking plaza. They have a huge selection of noodle soup, sandwiches, and rice dishes. Don't expect to have any service. In fact, you may have to go get your own menu because sometimes there is no one in the front end... may be they like to hide in the kitchen?!  We had lunch here twice within one week. We've tried Bun Bo Hue $7.49 (tender slices of beef, garnished with fried onions and mixed veggie in a spicy hue-style round noodle beef soup), Bun Rieu $6.49 (vermicelli rice noodle served with tofu, tomatoes, and mixed veggie in a fine shrimp and crab paste soup), Com Ca Hai Nam $7.99 (steamed Hoi-nan chicken with rice and ginger sauce), Bun Rieu Oc $6.99 (vermicelli rice noodle served with escaargots, tofu, tomatoes, and mixed veggie in a fine shrimp and crab paste soup), Vietnamese ice coffee with milk $3.23.   All the noodle soup were yummy. The chicken with rice dish was quite bad - not the correct way to make Hoi-nan chicken and the meat was very old... but the rice was good. Overall, I think it worth a try especially if you like noodle soup!

photos.caption: Photo of Pho Thanh Huong - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Yummy noodle soup!
Photo of Pho Thanh Huong - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Interior

wDm5sKMSamX26hHlUUPlhg.text: Update: Returned again Excellent service very nice people working there and fresh delicious food, the owner even contactes me and thanked me for my review, who does that nowadays? Nobody! That's service and with some  follow up! Love the banh mi and the Pho. Very clean and comfortable restaurant, it's my new favorite. I highly recommend this restaurant cannot say enough good things about it.

photos.caption: Photo of Pho Thanh Huong - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Nanh Mi!
Photo of Pho Thanh Huong - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Eating a &#34;Nanh Mi&#34;
Photo of Pho Thanh Huong - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The &#34;Nanh Mi&#34; ask for it!

wruV4xG8Z73ayh2rT8KKQA.text: Love this place specially thier bahn mi #56!! You cannot beat the price plus 10% off if you showed them your unlv card.

I-nOyE3WxK8kaTGyfd-Lyg.text: I have never had Vietnamese sandwiches before and this seemed to be the place to go to try it. I was visiting from Chicago not too long ago and was happy to be able to get some authentic Vietnamese fare. I tried the #2 sandwich,cant remember exactly what it had but it was fresh, simple yet very tasty. I also tried the BBQ pork one on another day and was even more impressed. I love that their prices are very affordable. One of these sandwiches beats spending 5-7 dollars at subway any day!!  Oh an another plus, my friends and I who were traveling back to Chicago decided to pick a sandwich up for the plane ride. I ended up not eating it till after landing and the sandwich held up really well throughout the whole day!

HNj5GGBcXdnPgpPv_x9Fjg.text: I have eaten from here numerous times though I have only dined in once.  I worked near by for a while and usually placed my order for take-out.  Given the in and out nature of my usual visits, to speak of poor service as others have would be irresponsible of me.  Instead I will rate the food and nothing more.    I always get the same menu item when I go.  It is not pho.  It is not bahn mi.  I don't know the name of the dish I get but I can tell you it is my favorite.  Rice noodles with grilled pork and shrimp, peanuts, lettuce, a salad of carrot and daikon, and a spring roll.  It has always been good.  The pork is tender and flavorful.  The shrimp is not overcooked.  The spring roll was hot enough to scorch my mouth last time I went.  It is always crispy and flakey.  I crave it some times.  In fact, I'm kind of craving it now.  I have had the same dish else where and it was good there too.  When it comes to Pho Thanh Huong though, it is the original for me.  It is where I choose to eat when I need a good noodle fix on the go.
