EjxJ0daOWXMFePNO7cAUHg.text: Wow! What a great find in a small, unassuming place. The Banh Mi sandwiches were GREAT, the spring rolls were GREAT and the Egg Rolls may be the best you've ever had! The service was spot on. Highly recommended!

0y6Ik2WsWFDQhoXsaO0izg.text: Hands down the best Pho you'll find in Las Vegas. I come here at least once a week and they always know my order. They run an amazing business and the food is incredible. Every time I have friends in town I bring them here and they love it. The service is great and the prices are even better.

aPX_-V8uxO2gUPX7-1YWhg.text: The portions were more than generous, and the menu is vegetarian friendly.  Also, the waitress was so kind and attentive. The Vietnamese coffee is just what I needed for the night's study haul. In total, a bowl of vegetarian pho (pho chay) and 2 iced coffees came out to $15. Glad that it's so close to UNLV, will be visiting again when my wallet allows it.

HDbLNMTdOVHamzbk_LdxAg.text: I have been coming here for many years. Their customer service meets my satisfaction and that matters to most customers. My favorite appetizer would be the spring rolls. It is best spring rolls I've had compared to other pho restaurants. Their pho is filled with outstanding flavors unlike these other watered down pho restaurants, this one will top most of them.   Their location is right by the airport and literally by UNLV. HIGHLY RECOMMEND THIS PHO RESTAURANT.

_kpHPxfK20k4lnHWSl-Rtg.text: Do the banh mi dance!  You take one banh mi in one hand, and another banh mi in another.  And then you dance spastically, but also slowly.  You're pretty much randomly jousting the sammies at people, I think.  One of my friends invented the dance.  Not me.  Anyway, the banh mi is pretty good here.  The bread is soft and fluffy like a cloud.  It isn't a long baguette.  It is more of an ovular shape.  (Perfect shape for banh mi dances). Stout would be the correct way to describe it.  The grilled pork is flavorful and tangy.  The jalapenos give you a nice kick in the pants.  The ratio of meat to radishes to jalapenos to cilantro is just perfect.  At $2.50 and some change, this is the cheapest and tastiest near the strip!

photos.caption: Photo of Pho Thanh Huong - Las Vegas, NV, United States. half of a grilled pork banh mi

2HNYB88USwQaQt3fCioWWw.text: The BEST egg rolls, Vietnamese ice coffee, & Vietnamese sandwiches in town!! We order large party trays of egg rolls for many of our parties! Our guests always love them!!

b9BOxelSmkBVDOc_Gw2ARg.text: I've only been here a few times and I always get the #56 sandwich. It's very tasty and fresh. For $3.25 it's a great lunch. Some day I'll be adventurous and try the pho dishes.

photos.caption: Photo of Pho Thanh Huong - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Number 56 pretty good

P1OYzh30aLKZeU7nOXzTPA.text: The veggie and tofu pho was so, so good.  Flavorful broth and tofu, crisp tender carrots, broccoli, bok choy and cabbage.  Fried onions set it all over the edge.   My husband enjoyed his pork banh mi, and the spring rolls were pretty good too.  Efficient and friendly servers.

CJEfVicJgZew6WQS_o-05g.text: First of all I'd like to say that this is probably the best Vietnamese restaurant I have been to simply based upon the facts that it's super cheap and the food is amazing. In my opinion that is one of the best combinations if you're looking for a quick bite to eat. Secondly, their Vietnamese sandwiches are a awesome they are really big and cheap.

YzLsBE_vS7xWxWcJu5N0Cg.text: I stopped into Thanh Huong for some lunch before class since I had some time to spare. I was the only one there, the service was great, the cashier at the front rang me up and made my sandwich in less than 5 minutes. Kudos to him.  HOWEVER...He shouldn't have had to do that ...there were 2 other employees on the side of the restaurant hanging out.   The restaurant is pretty spacious and very clean. I got the chicken and pate sandwich which was decent for $3.50. The fillings were great but what makes a good vietnamese sandwich is the bread. I found the bread to be too crumbly...I ended up with crumbs all over me lol. They should think about converting to baguettes like most Vietnamese sandwich shops have...it is easier to eat.   The place is decent for a quick bite before class...but I'd probably go to Mr. Sandwich once that opens by UNLV if I'm craving Vietnamese sandwiches.

qpSgovQBLnujiaunmiLqbA.text: I have been here several times and the food and service never disappoint. The broths are so fresh and full of flavor! This place is my favorite Pho restaurant, and will continute to be my son and myself's drewy day soup spot!

NpRU7v5lprHp8g6lXISNwA.text: Excellent food and service.I love this pho place.It is a hole in the wall kind of restaurant located not so far from UNLV.This restaurant have a wide selection for Bun mini and Pho as well as bona drink.I have been here several time and every time I am impressed with good food and service.I ordered Bun Riue and my friend order Pho Tai.Also we ordered Cha Goo,so good.The negative side for this restaurant is the pho here comes in a big portion If you do not eat that much I would recommend  you to share it with someone.The waiting staffs here always have a nice smile and greet promptly each time I visit this restaurant.Definitely one of my favourite Pho place.

photos.caption: Photo of Pho Thanh Huong - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cha Gio,si yummy!

U9Qtnwh0a5X69DVKNt477A.text: The best pho place with the best prices and the best staff and experience! I recommend the Pho Chay with vegetables and tofu but sub the tofu with chicken. For $3 extra you can make it extra large portion. The baked chicken sandwich is also great. The best place ever, in fact among all cuisines. I love it that much.

7kDwDOApKiJ_EWA9tfa3bQ.text: Food not bad ,not good too pricy service sometime slow. Waiter need more professional than just drop food and disappear.

fMHjjOE3eKSq2qhpe1-d2A.text: For being away from China Town this place is legit! Lucky UNLVers can get their fill of great sandwiches and Vietnamese cuisine, a hot to for me is the #32 virmacilli bowl which has a great array of flavors with not too much guilt on the calorie side.  All in all a solid place to get some good eats if your on this side of town!

photos.caption: Photo of Pho Thanh Huong - Las Vegas, NV, United States. #32 Vermacilli bowl with shrimp and pork

EiA1PJMNUuIaFFNLwHBl-g.text: I just cannot like this place.  Or maybe I should just say Pho in general.  I have tried.  Honestly, I have.  And if I have tried at any place, it is certainly this location.  The decor is plain.  Some carpeting and a standard counter with plenty of table space for groups.  The menu photos are bleak.  And the soup is basically water and noodles with vegetables and whatever else you tell them to throw in there for the price.  I have had friend after friend drag me in to this place and tell me that Pho would change my life.  Sadly, however, it did not.  It was simply Pho.  And I was unsatisfied.  The location is convenient for UNLV students, being located right by campus.  The prices were reasonable for water soup in a bowl.  But try as I might, and no matter how many spices I tried to throw in it to flare it, it was still just runny, watery, soup.  If you like Pho and you don't mind simple decor and okay service, you will probably enjoy this place.  But if you're never ventured towards the land of Vietnamese soups and you're wondering - you can probably pass.

tXd6dzqaEr6usIFzfJiJMQ.text: The best beef broth I've had in Vegas. Ordered their king size pho with beef, tendon, and brisket, and it did not disappoint! Love it!

GaJESGtw4a0iScUkSggNFw.text: This place was great! Didn't really know what to expect going in but the place was really nice, I dug the atmosphere. But the best thing had to be the Pho, I got the seafood Pho with beef broth and it was excellent. Would 100% go back & planning on it. The service wasn't bad at all either. Nice people. Just a weird location though, but it's Vegas what do you expect?

tCQGPcnUd4EyR_b5LZNnZA.text: Perfect location,  good costumer service,  great food and reasonable prices.  I had the grilled chicken sandwich (3.50$) really good filling sandwich

photos.caption: Photo of Pho Thanh Huong - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Grilled chicken sandwich.  Ready in 3 minutes exactly :)

BZ4ZbcsgjOcrNqWzcjAE1A.text: After the chilly walk thru the Ethel M Gardens and Christmas lights, my friend and I decided we needed a little heat, so we were off to look for Pho. A quick yelp search brought this place up so we headed over.  Located in the shopping center with Vons or Smiths grocery (not sure which) on the SW corner of Maryland Pkwy and Tropicana. Very nice restaurant, clean, and with plenty of seating. They were playing the football game on TV so +1 for me.   Ordered the pork chop and a bowl of Pho Tai Chin. Food came out quickly and was decent, the pork chop was kind of small but flavorful. The Pho was very tasty, with plenty of meat to go with the broth. I always taste the broth before adding anything, and this had a nice flavor. A little squeeze of lime and a few bean sprouts and its all warm in my belly.  Its not fancy, but its good. Its not expensive, but its good. Will definitely be back because its easier to get here than to the places on Eastern. Family owned and operated.

photos.caption: Photo of Pho Thanh Huong - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pork chop

SkQn2aVPypFsdPm4BmbqOw.text: This place is 7.5 out of 10. I feel like it's expensive compared to Chinatown locations and the portion is smaller. Food isn't bad but unless you're east of the strip, I'd just go to Spring Mountain.

Nc1xLLFXAMsjTNLHeLNEJg.text: Great food. We arrived with 10 people after 1pm and we immediately got a table. One star off because our orders got mixed up. They don't know who ordered what and had to ask all of us what our orders were. I'm not familiar with Vietnamese food, but we just followed the pix. I ended up with the wrong food. Only found out when I bit into a cilantro but I ordered without.

photos.caption: Photo of Pho Thanh Huong - Las Vegas, NV, United States. #93

bCVebch01_l4CgLhaikBrw.text: Best Vietnamese restaurant I've eaten at in Vegas (and I've eaten at lots!). The pho has a rich flavorable broth, the grilled pork chops are the best I've had, the egg rolls are a nice large size and you can taste the crab/seafood flavor. There were ten of us and everyone enjoyed their meal.

714rTrRK5m27T0pKh2Lqqg.text: The 4 stars on Yelp must be Las Vegas standards because this place smells and feel dirty.  We ordered Pho, Cha Gio, Banh Mi and Che Ba Mau.  The only good item is the Banh Mi Tht Nng.  The Ph, Ch Gio and Che Ba Mau were disappointing and barely edible.  The Ph did not have much flavor and the broth was not clear and layered with nuances of  Pho spices.  The Ch gio was soggy and oily and the worst of the bunch is the Che Ba Mau.  The mung bean and red beans were undercooked and lacking in flavor.  The coconut milk is bland and the jelly was tasteless.  The whole thing was so gross that I threw it in the trash.  I hope the owners see this review and take steps to improve because I really want to like this restaurant.  It have plenty of parking.

QBU0BnZJnJVel5iWMOl7BA.text: This Place is really good! Try it! They Have good Pho and pork chops. My Husband and I discovered this little Gem a few months ago and have been back at least 3 times. Never disappointed.

3NhdNF7rRSH7LFVLezTXdQ.text: So so...friendly service, average portions, fairly good food. Pho, banh mi, the usual suspects. Not the best I've had but I'd go again, if I was in the neighborhood.

35JUlbHZiMVDrEdmVOOlLw.text: TLDR: Get the pho, bahn mi, and fresh fruit smoothies, but skip the boba.   The #11 combination pho has a great, savory broth and ample meat and toppings. They pack this really well for takeout, if you're in a rush.  Their bahn mi are made with fresh, fantastic French bread- some of the best bread I've found in town, actually. For under $4, the sando is stuffed with toppings, but I'd personally ask for extra pate.  They advertise the smoothies as being made with fresh fruit- I'm not sure how True that is but the jackfruit version is perfection in a cup. Not too sweet, no artificial flavor, would get again... But their boba is pretty flavorless, so I'd skip that. Smoothies automatically come with boba (for $5/ea) but if you as for it without, they're closer to $3- but they may forget and give you boba anyway out of habit (happened to me).

photos.caption: Photo of Pho Thanh Huong - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bahn mi chit thit
Photo of Pho Thanh Huong - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Jack fruit smoothie with boba

FFB0CvjSG9IM2wIpMrdKSw.text: The waiter was very friendly and helpful. The service was quick. The pho was really good and came with a lot of meat which was nice. The grilled pork banh mi was very generous with its meat and tasted really good.

photos.caption: Photo of Pho Thanh Huong - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Apps and bevs
Photo of Pho Thanh Huong - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Menu for when it&#39;s party time
Photo of Pho Thanh Huong - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Rare steak meatball

OBVm0grAD-R0_kIHFutOlg.text: We came here on a very hot July 4th. Services were great. The waiter got us ice water immediately. So we ordered two bowls of pho, one bowl of bun bo hue, and an order of spring rolls. The spring rolls were very loosely wrapped, not like the rolls that typically from other Vietnamese restaurant. The pho was good not great. The bun bo hue was very very bland, it was pho broth with a little spice color, not good!!!!

PkGLtOoHBeZxS7g9V4Z1nA.text: I usually stop by here with my coworkers for lunch. The servers are friendly and attentive. The food is good I usually order the pork chop plate which is delicious with the sauces they serve all over everything. I've tried the pho and can say the broth is excellent. I also tried the pork bahn mi which is really good the bread is super soft too.

PYxNzCuz9kVlt5XgGn28sg.text: This place has saved my life a few times and a few trips to Spring Mountain. I usually pack my lunch when I have to be at UNLV across the street but 75% of the time, I eat my lunch right after breakfast...on the way to school.  By the time I get out of class, my stomach has already eaten itself. I need to eat constantly. The food comes out quick and I never to have to wait to be seated. Lots of parking.  I normally get the same items: egg rolls, Thai tea and a bowl of pho. The egg rolls are warm and crunchy, and the filling is tasty. The pho is always steaming hot...the broth is good.  Service has always been the greatest out of the Vietnamese restaurants I've been to in town. I always come here solo and I like joking around with the staff here. They're nice like that.

photos.caption: Photo of Pho Thanh Huong - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Spring Rolls
Photo of Pho Thanh Huong - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pho Tai Nam
Photo of Pho Thanh Huong - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Thai Tea and Egg Rolls

cXlu149PN5LJeO5fvORYWg.text: The service is great.  The egg rolls and spring rolls are extremely good.  Egg rolls are nice and crispy with a good filling and they don't feel greasy (also came hot piping hot!) The chicken sandwich is amazing and only $3.99.  You can't go wrong here

qRJc7ESa8hhTHmMGE7XLMA.text: Tasty food. Very few vegetarian options. Some of them contain seaweed and it smells like fish.

S8cyxu-QH5kwngfM0txhWw.text: Solid Pho place!!! No frills, good food. Technically this is a solid 3 star if compared to some of the best Pho places I've had.  If this was compared to food in Vegas ONLY, I'd probably would rate this a 4.

2O2iMeOQ4xqJY0J3fF8CEg.text: Close to home but not exactly like Argyle. It's a tradeoff. Happy with what I ordered.

77tAnkNE7VXaIoTnxOo9wQ.text: Awesome grilled pork Bahn Mi, spring rolls and pho tai. This is my go to place when I'm feeling some Vietnamese food.

5AuvUz9W9PQzHyLxHHReOw.text: Yesterday EDC ended & tons of people leaving with many of them stopping in at my favorite restaurant & of course it was extremely busy however I was so impressed by how the girls working were able to handle the amount of customers that came in when I was there today, this place is normally busy anyways, however I was much more impressed today with what I call exceptional outstanding service with the waitresses maintaining happy & smiling faces during this busy & I'm sure stressful time.  I was extremely impressed with the waitress Tatiana who seemed to have handled every table it seemed with a positive & friendly service towards this young aged crowd even though there were some unreasonable customers, kudos Pho Than Huong for having great waitresses.  I do want to mention another waitress that worked the other evening when I was there her name I believe was Kiana, she is such a friendly person and her constant smile puts an ease on my face & attitude after a long day of working.  Thank you again & this place deserves my 5 star rating!  Good food & service rare combination!

KKDPRYsADwa-EuhLEtN5iA.text: I've been here a LONG time ago but since returning last month, I've noticed they changed up the restaurant and menu slightly.  The restaurant looks nice and clean, the service was very friendly and welcoming.   I've had the pleasure of sitting down to a nice bowl of Pho and they definitely improved on the flavors.    One of the good things about their Pho menu is it's newbie-friendly.   There's a picture of the different meats/ingredients, and you could choose to add any or all to your pho.   All the staples are there and then some.  I personally love everything but tripe in my soup.  The different cooked meats, meatballs, tendon.. so delicious.    More importantly though, their Bahn Mi (vietnamese sandwiches) are SO good here.   They bake their bread fresh and the portions of their meat and veggies are excellent.  I always order the grilled pork.  Just a tip: the Jalapeno slices they top the sandwich with are hot.  So ask them to put it on the side if you aren't sure you'd like them.  I've also enjoyed their vietnamese meatball sandwich, but their egg and chinese sausage sandwich wasn't much to talk about.  I've already bought 6 sandwiches and brought them to my co-workers.  They are IN LOVE with it.   Super damn good!

photos.caption: Photo of Pho Thanh Huong - Las Vegas, NV, United States. To go. Chinese sausage and fried egg.
Photo of Pho Thanh Huong - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Grilled pork vietnamese sandwich.  Bigger than they used to be.  Awesome!
Photo of Pho Thanh Huong - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pho dac biet.

WCWhlMr7HG4IZBVQaKAUmA.text: Very delicious vegetarian pho. My husband had a seafood pho and said delicious as well. It was pass 9pm, all the shops near our house were closed. This place was a great find. The server girls are so efficient and attentive.

qw32pqfFlbm5J_lrwIDSrA.text: Pretty good food and friendly staff. I docked them a star because of the location. BUT YOU GET TWO FREE EGG ROLLS WHEN YOU MENTION YELP. The Pho was excellent as were both the spring and egg rolls. While I did not try the sandwiches, by sight they seemed to be very good, I was shocked at their very low price.   So if you're looking for a good friendly meal and you're in the area, give them a try. BTW, it seemed like the local Vietnamese people like it. At least I assume that was the language of about half the clientele.

photos.caption: Photo of Pho Thanh Huong - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Menu

6qTQMhX2vsy1PIjk97Af9A.text: This food was so good!! Not expensive at all, if you're craving quail, fish balls, pho, or any type of vietnamese food, this is the place.   I have been to a few pho and ramen spots this is my go to now, I will be back many more times in the next month lol.

photos.caption: Photo of Pho Thanh Huong - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Beef short ribs
Photo of Pho Thanh Huong - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Seafood pho
Photo of Pho Thanh Huong - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Quail, fish balls, and spring rolls with beef

tJOvITMPaWFZAe9aGNSwgA.text: I am Vietnamese and moved to LV recently and have been looking for traditional Vietnamese cuisine. This place is good for banh mi sandwiches and rice plates but lacks traditional Vietnamese value in the vermicelli noodle bowls and appetizers. I am disappointed with the quantity of food you get in takeout, I feel like it's far less than other places. The deep fried egg rolls traditionally are rice paper filled with noodles, veggies, and lettuce. This restaurant however, does it the cheap way. They use a different wrap that's not rice paper and fill it with a big piece of meat. It's just a log of sausage. Traditional Vietnamese egg rolls are extremely different and better. I am disappointed that this restaurant and many other pho restaurants in the area don't do real authentic traditional egg rolls.   The pork and shrimp vermicelli was great, the nuoc mum was a little sweeter than what I prefer but was still great. Overall it's an okay restaurant but for someone like me who is Vietnamese and knows tradition....I'll stick to a place that's more authentic.

OFKceqdXQ-pa290Boqm-Wg.text: Coming from OC near "Little Saigon" I'm familiar with authentic vietnamese pho.  This place is pretty authentic and worth your Pho fix!

RF7ZLAhIwVn9KwRSeCELvg.text: The com tam was done very well! It wasn't amazing which is why I didn't give it 5 stars, but it was good enough to satisfy my cravings. Definitely, recommend if you're in the mood for a rice dish

tmvKWVHMv_RSj4KM_o_ONg.text: I know where I'm going when I have my next banh mi craving! Finally, a place that meets my expectations. Fresh tasting crunchy on the outside and soft on the inside bread, well seasoned and good portioned meat, and perfectly pickled veggies. My go to sandwich is the grilled pork banh mi ($3.25). I've tried the pricier ones like the lemongrass beef banh mi, which was good, but was not worth the price. Very friendly service and my order was complete in less than 10 minutes.  I'll have to try the pho next time!   *****Yelp 2016 100 challenge***** 17/100

photos.caption: Photo of Pho Thanh Huong - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lemongrass beef banh mi ($8). Tasty, but I would stick with the lesser priced sandwiches.
Photo of Pho Thanh Huong - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Grilled pork banh mi $3.25. Yummy!

FSkO2EV18GCsdNhtgP8Hlg.text: Are you on campus and don't want to go through the hassle of getting on any ramps on any freeways and want some Vietnamese food or pho? If you don't mind getting inside your whip and driving around the corner of Tropicana and Maryland, you will find that Pho Thanh Huong is the place for you.   The food here is decent and the flavor of the pho that I ordered tasted good. Standard regular and large sizes. The value is decent for what you get.  Service does their job and refills drinks.   Located in the plaza with Vons and PT's. There is plenty of parking.

KcMDNOL7YIKd6FzHZndXag.text: Their pho soup is great! It's not too thick or light and doesn't seem to have too much grease sitting. I tried their pho tai chin and loved it.   Their service is great as well. Two different servers kept asking if we needed anything. They even let us put a Monster energy drink in their fridge so that it can be kept cool.  I recommend this place and will be back if I hit Vegas!

5BpWRhxPQH1WWvtWwa5fiw.text: This was our last spot before leaving Vegas and glad we found it. When we got there we got on a waiting list but didn't wait too long. I ordered vegetable pho and it was really good. Everyone at the table was pleased with their food as well. Good service to top of the great food.

photos.caption: Photo of Pho Thanh Huong - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Phó!

TH8nT4OIMSlx6FKY5ReYyg.text: Stopped by to grab sandwiches before heading back to Arizona. We ordered 6 of the grilled pork banh mi sandwiches based off the reviews and were not disappointed. The baguette was slightly crunchy on the outside and soft on the inside. The grilled pork was to die for! I would love to have this recipe. Also, the extra veggies made it even better.  Our only regret was not ordering more for the road. Next time, this will be my first stop before heading to The Strip!

4enoDFienOj7TmzJMn_IHA.text: Ordered:  Pho Dac Biet Banh Mi Thit Nuong  Loved both items that I ordered. The baguette is made at the location and it's made perfectly. It's hard on the outside and soft on the inside. The flavor of the meat is sweet and savory. The banh mi is just perfect! . The pho was actually flavorful unlike most locations where it tastes a bit watered down. Pretty much always here for lunch!

k1I4LpFprcC32P2s_GvbJg.text: Love this place! The Pho is really really good. The broth is clear, noodles have the perfect amount of chewyness, and smells delightful. The cuts of beef offered aren't the best in terms of fattiness and flavor but doesn't take away from how tasty the Pho is. The customer service is on point! If you're looking for Vientnamese coffee, this place is legit!! The best in Vegas by far!

sEUoMrcbJzAcOv05ltT_6A.text: A friend and I decided to give this place a try after trying to hunt down a good place for pho. We were not disappointed the food was not only delicious, but affordable! I highly recommend this restaurant!

0LcwWUstTumzXKWaLyXnww.text: Our family loves pho! We wanted to try this place while visiting Vegas and for the price it was pretty decent! We got the brisket/flank pho and the veggies and tofu pho. I thought it had nice flavor and the veggies were plentiful.   Yelp has this business closing at 9 pm but the sign on the door says open till 10 - so keep that in mind.   We left with full bellies and empty bowls and for that, we thank you!

Lg_pFs6dek8qJT-z1Gn4ww.text: Wasn't a fan of the broth but there was really good service and food was decent. The spring rolls I ate were good

dHP9Y2oO1m9XVWdufeBryQ.text: Awesome pho, vermicelli bowl (spicy pork and shrimp), and bomb banh mi. Service was great as well and waters were filled quickly. Would not recommend the spring rolls.

aA3blm5fwso5L-HiE8KI0g.text: Really great pho! Very reasonable price comparing to California & Chicago (where my family and I live), great taste and big size! Just bookmarked the place and certainly coming back next time I'm here!:D  P.S. their Vietnamese coffee is great too!

LCUMR9CmbzNKIbNoWGusZQ.text: Wen there for dinner around 8ish and got a table for three right away.  Pho and com Thit nuong were good.  Two bowl of pho and one rice plate cost about $32.  Friendly service and fast.

photos.caption: Photo of Pho Thanh Huong - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Com Thit xuong
Photo of Pho Thanh Huong - Las Vegas, NV, United States. combination pho
Photo of Pho Thanh Huong - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pho with meat, meatballs, and tendon.

7ruZOeEfmzQmt375AIca3Q.text: 4.5 stars if I could do the .5. I used to come here a lot for the Bahn mi and pho when I was attending unlv. Reviewing it now based on this visit.  Came for lunch on a Monday. Place was busy. You got people waiting for to-go orders and people arriving to get seated.  They sat us at an open table pretty quick but it was dirty. Server noticed and cleaned it right away after we had sat.  We each did the check in but I realized you just have to mention the free eggrolls to get it I think.   We ordered:  *2 free eggrolls -  he didn't bring the fish sauce sauce that you dip it.. I waited for my dish which usually comes with it to come out before I could eat it lol Bf dipped it in the peanut sauce. It didn't have much veggies in it and was quite packed with filling which I didn't hate. It was okay but hey, free.  *fresh spring rolls 2pcs. w/ pork and shrimp I found them decent spring rolls, not too much lettuce. The peanut sauce was lighter and less thicker than most places but I actually preferred it like that.  *Pho combo with everything but tripe and tendon Bf ordered this and said it was quite watered down and I agree. The broth didnt have depth. It didnt make you WANT to scoop another spponful of it after one bite. He had to use hoisin sauce to add some flavor. But it didn't taste like a mouthful of msg either which would have you chugging water even after eating it.  *grilled pork chops Two thin but good sized chops on the bone. They were seasoned really well, not too salty or sweet and not overcooked either. The fish sauce sauce went well with it but could also do without it too. The pickled daikon and carrots that comes on the plate were flavorless. I usually eat it to cut the oil and fat at the end but it wasn't pickled with the right amount of sugar and vinegar. I wondered if they used that on their sandwiches..  I would come back for the chops and spring rolls if i was in the area for sure.

photos.caption: Photo of Pho Thanh Huong - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Done right
Photo of Pho Thanh Huong - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Grilled pork chops  are a must
Photo of Pho Thanh Huong - Las Vegas, NV, United States

1lymPltF-hFy9o6VRRiDvQ.text: Most authentic Vietnamese food around the UNLV area.  FOOD: Most people come here for the Vietnamese sandwiches because they taste good and are about $4 each. The french bread used is made in house daily. The grilled pork sandwich is the best. Their rice dish are their most well prepared dishes. The owner originally own a rice shop called Da Lat before and has brought their great rice dish recipes here to Thanh Huong. I highly recommend the thin grilled pork rice dish. Their pho is decent, but isn't the best in town.  DRINK: They offer many authentic Vietnamese drinks, but the Vietnamese coffee is the best here. Be warned Vietnamese coffee is extra dark served hot or iced with condensed milk.  ATMOSPHERE: Nothing special, just a quick grab and go restaurant. Close to UNLV.

photos.caption: Photo of Pho Thanh Huong - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Vietnamese coffee
Photo of Pho Thanh Huong - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Special combination pho
Photo of Pho Thanh Huong - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Vietnamese pancake

Czwx_KJRIyyTzhw4J8WOwg.text: I think it's bit expensive for the pho with poor flavor and not enough meats. The Bun Rieu is in fact the worse I have ever tasted, it really ruins my appetite. They really have to improve their pho and Bun Rieu.

OOMBcPC-G3IeoFh5Sf1Sow.text: When I lived in California, pho was always one of my favorite rainy day foods because of the warm, comforting feeling I would get after eating a huge bowl of it. On one of those rare rainy days here in Vegas, I began to feel a little homesick and decided to try this restaurant.   Upon walking in I was greeted by the friendly staff which automatically gave this place a couple stars. Customer service is a big part of my dining experience at any restaurant, and this place definitely meets my expectations. I decided to get a bowl of pho with brisket and sliced beef. My order came out quickly and was bigger than I had expected. The broth has a very good flavor and tastes even better with the addition of the bean sprouts, lime juice, and basil leaves. The meat was very tasty and plentiful as well.   When I went to the counter to pay my check, I discovered that the huge bowl of pho was only $8.50! The only thing I love besides good food is cheap food. I will definitely be coming back here to satisfy my random pho cravings.

photos.caption: Photo of Pho Thanh Huong - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pho !

8no2vUwwDbo3MDoj9TfD3w.text: Surprisingly good bowl of pho. Authentic and good service. Will be back to try their sandwiches next time.

hyG8oe4P18HyrkU18Et0cg.text: This place is wonderful.  The staff is so friendly and I am never disappointed in the quality of food.  My favorite is the #11 with everything!  We come here maybe twice a week (or try to) since the prices are fantastic for their portions.  If you're looking for good pho, come here. I'm so happy that we found this place!

krUnpYt-XCygmcW7xVUEPA.text: Best Banh mi in Las Vegas. Close to UNLV and McCarran... When I fly or go to a Rebels game, I go with a couple sandwiches from Pho Thanh Huong.  Fellow passengers look on in awe when I pull this delicacy from my briefcase (I do go a little heavy on the fish sauce). Meanwhile, if you are not in a rush, their full compliment of Pho is always prepared just right... It's in the broth.  Of course they have Thai Boba Tea and all the best that Vietnamese cuisine has to offer.  Their spare ribs are as good as any Korean Kalbi you can find!  My kids eat the stuff like candy.  If you're here in Vegas for a convention or on vacation and looking for something delicious and different... Pho Thanh Huong is right down the street from the Strip. Go to this restaurant... You will love it!

photos.caption: Photo of Pho Thanh Huong - Las Vegas, NV, United States. My grandson Izaiah loves the Spare Ribs... #20 on the menu.

gYO-VDeDyQnoabwPcErCAQ.text: I've been to this place plenty of times because it is near my house. I wanted to give the place 3 1/2 because it really isn't that fancy of a place but I rounded up.  There's plenty of seating, something I always enjoy. They let you sit wherever. Most of the seating is built for larger parties, so if it's just 1 or 2 people, you might feel bad taking up a whole top. Don't worry, I've never seen it get super packed.  The Pho is what I get here. I usually just get the Pho with Rare and Flank steak. It's always been pretty good for me. You can get a baked french roll for 50 cents with was a nice addition to the Pho. The Thai tea was also pretty delicious.  The service is nice. It always feels like a bunch of high school kids working there, but there are pretty attentive and nice. Always looking to refill the water in your cup.  While the Pho has always been pretty good, I do have to say I can't vouch for the other food. One time I got a sandwich there, some rib sandwich. I did bite into it and I hit a bone in the meat. Why the hell there was a bone in meat in a sandwich is beyond me, but that was the only time I ever had an issue. I'm just so big into Pho there, I don't bother with anything else.   I think this place is worth a shot for people. They updated their menus so it looks much cleaner. They keep the place looking pretty nice. The staff is attentive and nice. The food is good. It's a nice Pho place.

crWWezC23BsyuUj73w6uAw.text: Their pho is usually very good, however there was once that they served pho with very salty soup broth that tasted different than before. Sometimes when you come in to the restaurant there's some fishy smell.

GFcMA3tfZ6Ti05jGHxIW0g.text: I always thought that this place had the best Bahn mi (vietnamese style sandwiches) in town. I havent been here in a long time and found out that they recently changed owners about 6 months ago.   Pork Bahn mi - They raised their prices about 50 cents, it used to be 3 dollars now its 3.50. The bread is pretty good but it seems a little bit more chewy than it was before. The fillings seemed to have gotten worse. They were Extremely stingy on the fillings and it was salty. Also didn't seem as juicy as before, maybe they need to add more mayo.  Sometimes when you try something great and find out that ownership has change, and it's not as good as before, it kinda pisses me off.

photos.caption: Photo of Pho Thanh Huong - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pork bahn mi - not as good as before, good bread, average fillings.

VHSPduG9x9p7QHNM2uYrPQ.text: Excellent pho. Great service. Cute kid works here I give five starts cuz I don't usually eat pho but I finish all of it

5W2fOsyRrF4BuU3h0k0Gsg.text: I have been to this place 1-2 times per month over the past six years. The sandwiches are very good and the price is good.   Tl:dr good sandwiches, good price, long wait times without telling you if they are busy. Details below.   Unfortunately I won't be heading back anytime soon due to the sub par service I received as well as the attitude.   My mom was in town and wanted something quick so I suggested this place as we can order to go and it would be no problem.   Ordered 9 sandwiches. I saw tables that sat after I ordered being served sandwiches after I placed my order. After 20 minutes of waiting I asked for the status and the counter girl said it would be an additional 15 bc the back was busy. In the end it ended up taking 50 minutes and they shorted me one sandwich. They also did every single sandwich incorrectly from what ordered. At the end I told the girl next time if she could let a person know an order was going to take longer than half an hour in the beginning it would be better and her response was to call in the order next time. I always tip on a to go order and at that point I asked for the tip back which i regret doing as the other staff deserved it.   Wish them the best of luck and sorry that my regular counter girl wasn't there today.

8gSXBUJeL9WU9z9GSPV_Ig.text: Pretty good pho here and the service was quick and friendly. It's located across the street from UNLV in a strip mall. Make sure you have a cab driver's number (unless you drove) or else it's tough to catch a ride back.

_N6036CbY7snwTEhYEb1Rw.text: It was really too hot in Las Vegas for pho, but pho is a damn good hangover cure and it was, after all, the Saturday after a REALLY good night.  The service was really good and all the food came out very quick. They had fresh coconut which was a treat in 100 degree weather. Prices were also very fair considering the amount of food... We really could've done 2 people to a bowl but our cognitive powers were not at their best at the time. Great off-strip option without being too far away.

y10wHeaPTaJtYN-SUKEKEg.text: I live so close to here now and I'm always here! Fresh Coconut for starters always, then the fried chicken wings!!! YUM! I love the pho obviously, it's delicious and huge. I have tried the Vietnamese sandwiches - so good and inexpensive :)   The service is always great, and fast!   Keep up the great cooking and service

BLJs2IvwPKfRSGRXWWSR_Q.text: I LOVE this place.....food is GREAT and workers are somewhat friendly. My regular spot....

I4T3ZJQXIvcU74Qh096PzA.text: All my sons doctors are right by this restaurant, so every time I'm in the area I stop by for some pho ga. Some of the best pho I've ever had and love the staff! I guess you can say I'm a regular. Wouldn't want to eat pho anywhere else honestly.

wohaCTHfICqyPOSqYb_s8g.text: The food was really delicious, I'm from Australia and it was nice to find a place that taste my home cooking. Came back for lunch the next day.

photos.caption: Photo of Pho Thanh Huong - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bun no hue
Photo of Pho Thanh Huong - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Grilled pork roll
Photo of Pho Thanh Huong - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Grilled chicken and rice

230YK7_w3orjEVtVaYUy_w.text: Went for dinner and ordered Pho Combo. The soup was good, but the noodle was very soggy. Oversoaked or leftovers. The basil looks very old, probably expired. Same with the bean sprouts. I had many Pho, but I have to say I was very disappointed, despite the positive reviews. Never going back again.      On the positive side, the server was very polite. Cashier was nice and friendly.

mSmialczAOSnYyPXJrgPGQ.text: This place deserves 0 and the health inspector needs to take a look!!!! A roach was in the soup I was feeding to my daughter!!!! Absolutely disgusting!!!!!! Never coming here again!

op4MbmZ5XIQOYU4JzaOmww.text: Great service very clean and I can't wait to come back and try other items on the menu. So many choices and I can only eat one item at a sitting.

nYkZZnnB-ssyBypvGFYHSQ.text: When the craving hits and china town is too far away. Finding a good banh mi sandwich is hit and miss but this place is spot on. Always clean , friendly staff and good food.  Also the portions are awesome lots of meat in the sandwiches, bread is always fresh. Great prices for students and hungry folks on a budget.

BzMR0CCZh-9n2bXLZcN_bw.text: Pho? On the East Side? Are you kidding?  No, not kidding. It's pretty darned good, too. And their Banh Mi are FANTASTIC!

bf0MWzgXpnot1FbxLSOegQ.text: This place will probably be my go to pho place whenever I'm in Vegas now. The location is convenient and pho is delicious.  Oh! I tried their banh mi thit as other reviewers suggested and it was awesome! The bread was perfectly crunchy, the jalapenos were a tad too spicy and I would have preferred a bit more pate, but the overall result was fab!  The service was friendly and prompt, we recieved our orders no less than 10 minutes after it was put in. Awesome.

e1LCpSdMKBaIbsvjSLgvsg.text: Nice balance of dishes, though not many are for pure vegetarians. Pho, while rather standard, is made of fresh veggies and a nice variety (mushrooms are extra $2 if you want them added to the vegetables/tofu pho). Crew is friendly and attentive.

photos.caption: Photo of Pho Thanh Huong - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Pho Thanh Huong - Las Vegas, NV, United States

Qf3QQq5jaYQg_5s0_pUM9w.text: I've only recently made the switch to vegetarianism, so this is only my second pho sans meat, and only one other experience to compare it to.  The vegetable to noodle ratio was off -- too much vegetable, not enough noodle. To be fair, my wife (a vegetarian) thought her pho was great. *shrugs*  My Viet Coffee also had more ice than there was liquid in the cup (as in, the ice had a good half-inch of not being submerged in liquid).  Minor complaints, but I will be glad to get to my regular pho experiences back in Los Angeles.

UzmkqA_wf72fHTbV0AChAA.text: Love this place. Best veggie pho in town. Ask for some rare beef added in, and some spring rolls to start. You won't be disappointed :)

b--RGJSgdyG_FJdwp3sK_g.text: Restaurant was 3 quarters full and we were seated immediately. The food was delicious but we had to continuously ask for items and we were missing a dish. Seemed like they were low on staff. The food was good but the service wasn't too great.

gJ1MSGEytzU0bW_qccHSbg.text: Great tasting French Vietnamese sandwiches at rock bottom prices.  The pho is not bad either (well just stay away from the blood cake unless you like that sort of thing.)    Service can be a little strange.  You order and they let you know when your food is ready...sometimes.  Sometimes, it just sits on the counter and everyone just disappears into the kitchen. Kinda funny.  Highly recommended if you're by UNLV and needing an inexpensive but good meal.

32fw837ycV6qeSmp36WhCw.text: I'm really upset.. I've been going here for years and WAS my favorite place.. Sadly came in today because I wasn't feeling well. Noticed the menu looked different, different staff.. Not sure if they changed owners, but the Pho WAS NOT AT ALL THE SAME! NOODLES were completely different. Kind of cheap tasting. Other food was great just upset that the Pho is no longer the same..

hS0GRG_St4lXdUW370gvNw.text: Ok, so we were a large group of black people but we like our pho. Service was ok, extremely slow, and she forgot a few items. We had to keep waving over the hostess who would then go into the kitchen to get our waitress.

nMHU2sx9yVYN_f2SaEHPdw.text: I haven't been back to Pho Thanh Huong since I moved to the southwest area 5 years ago. Since I was in the mood for Pho and couldn't find any good Pho in the chinatown/west part of town. I yelped and saw a couple posting about PTH.  Anyway, a bunch of my family members came back over the week and tried different things and here what we found:  - Pho is similar to other places I found on the west side of town. The broth is below average and  tasted just like someone dipped a pho flavor bag into hot water. It has no natural sweetness at all.  - Bun thit nuong (grill pork vermicelli (not sure if this is correct spelling but too lazy now to look it up) was good.  -  Except soda that came in a can, all their specially made drinks weren't good.  - The best thing I found at this place is their grill pork sandwich. It was very very good. I would drive all the way here just for this sandwich.  By the way, some yelpers mentioned about the weird smell of this place, which I experienced while I was there. It has that stale cigarette smell that you normally experience when visit really old casino.

jerhAOMScqyBY_9zysG4cA.text: Thank goodness I was craving pho today! I stopped by here with a couple of friends after two classes and enjoyed the pho and service very much! The cashier even gave us more discount on top of the UNLV student discount because we said we would be returning! He was funny and nice!

aeHeVwugmOPQNevGiqHNvw.text: I love this place. Great Vietnamese food and affordable. Would pick it over any restaurant on the strip anytime. Must try their banh mi.

SQBqZtg_DSeHvqESL5xysg.text: The restaurant has recently been taken over by new owners, a young couple, and they are very friendly. The Pho is pretty good, but I never had a bad pho anywhere in town. But their sandwiches are to die for. And they only cost $3-$3.50 (6' size).  The make their own bread in probably the biggest baking machine I've seen.  Overall great food and good service. This side of town needs more good Asian food, so we don't have to drive 1/2 hour to Chinatown every time.

PTsh4YceEIMOmImZaiKVfg.text: Ok normally I go up a star when giving a half rating! But this time I'm going down just to the blase attitude of everyone there!! Would have been 3 stars but food just wasn't good! I've been here before and had there sandwiches and pho, the sandwiches are always up to par!! With the crispy flaky bread& slaw ( the BBQ pork was my fave) but i probably won't be back after my last visit! Ordered the pho, had flank steak, tendon, beef? And tripe, ordered with no tripe! And got some funky meatball concoction! Also had more tripe and tendon than any other meat!! Of course no one checked back! We had ordered crispy spring rolls and sent those back as an appetizer, they were cold and not fried when we ordered the fried, the waitress who barely spoke English took them back, and the people behind the counter ate them in full view of us!! With there rubber gloves on, than proceeded to make the next persons sandwich with the same gloves on!! Poor guy!! Well when they came out they were microwaved and more chewy than crispy!! Double gross! Also the pho came out lukewarm and meat even tho thinly sliced took awhile to cook in broth!! Speaking of the broth it was very tangy and gosh I really don't kno how to describe it, but was not up to par the way it used to be ( we joked that maybe we really pissed them off and well ...... The bathroom is in full view of dining and two employees did go before we got our pho, just saying!!) my friend tried adding soy sauce , hoisen sauce everything , but that weird flavor didn't go away and finally gave up ! He only maybe had 1/5 of it, if that, and gave up, me I ate the noodles, & what beef there was, but really couldn't get into the broth either! So I left it!! When paying we told them we didn't like it and if they wanted to , go look at the table and see what we left ,nothing was taken off the check, and no real apology was given! I think we even payed for the first spring rolls that were the waitress's mistake! For 2 people it was over 35$ so I know I got ripped, but I was angry at their in different attitude and in turn they lost a customer !! Not that u go there that often about every 6 or 7 weeks but this last time will definetly be my last !! Poor food , poor service , and over priced go to Chinatown and get some options of pho eateries!! Hope this helps!!   UPDATE I lowered it 1 star after reading some other reviews, cuz both my friend and I did get sick after eating there!! And also forgot to say,they have really started to skimp on the meat, in sandwiches, which I guess it wAs good cuz there was less to throw up!! Lol

scn4ca8e9B9T4uaZC-8fHg.text: Very delicious food, and fast and friendly service. I will eat here every time I am in town.

5ouzDADulig69Y02gYLOiA.text: Good food! Good service. Of you want looking a place for Vietnamese cuisine should come here! I tried many dishes here really good!

QkRQOX0DRRQvNa9PmvZXPg.text: This is the BEST place for Vietnamese sandwiches. I even think it might be in the overall top best sandwich shops in lv. My family's been going here for years and all those guys are fat so I have some credibility. If you don't think so try for yourself. They bake the bread in house and it is like sex biting into the crisp then supple roll, they grill the pork to tender perfection and is marinated with mouth watering smoky sweet goodness. Ask for less or no jalapeno if you aren't a spicy fanatic, but I recommend training yourself to be CUZ THESE GUYS DO SPICY RIGHT!!! Every time go to this place the sandwiches and service are always awesome and my experience always definitely exceeds my expectation.

6tGbQIEiPoKl-44dshweXw.text: I am a HUGE Fan of Vietnamese Food and have had the opportunity to hit Vietnam several times for holiday. The food here is Delicious! Please start with the Quail! So YUMMY! Bo Thai Chan Chanh similar  to a carpaccio! Pho Thai, Bun Thit Nuong and Bahn Xeo!!

AmfC3l27Zwk5vsJ5XK8zjg.text: Awesome food and pho. Try the grilled pork sandwich.  You won't be disappointed. I eat here every week and I live pretty far from here.

H_uED4kS2upZ5EblSW29eA.text: They deserve 5 stars for what they deliver and they don't pretend to be anything fancy. This is a casual place/cafeteria but the food is phenomenal! The Bahn Mi is outstanding (they make the bread and it is a proper French roll). I live in CA but ALWAYS stop here when in Vegas or driving through. Breaks my heart that they are so far away.
